Recovered goods can be returned to any port for a small number of points, or they can be taken to that good's matching port for a large number of points. You can stockpile as many goods as you want before returning to port, but taking on too many goods will reduce your vessel's speed. Players must be realistic about the port they can reach before their rivals are upon them.

The ships in Merchant Marine act like large ships should -- they are hard to stop and cannot turn on a dime. Players must wrestle with these limitations even while exploiting the same weaknesses in their rivals. Run down another player to steal their precious cargo for yourself, or raise your sails in a desperate bid to outrun a more encumbered vessel.

The player with the most points when the final load of goods has been recovered from the sinking ship is the winner.

159237.name: Artefakt (Issue 29 - Jan 2013)
159237.description: This issue contains reviews, short fiction, a Shadowrun scenario (Chasing Ghosts), an essay on Shadowrun's history, and a short generic seed for a fantasy adventure.

159238.name: Artefakt (Issue 30 - 2013)
159238.description:
This issue contains adventures for Fading Suns and Kult, a short story, and comics.

Due to a lack of contributions, editor Joachim A. Hagen had to fill this issue almost completely by himself. Since the situation does not seem to change soon, and since his personal circumstances do not allow for that continuous time and effort, he resigns (after four years as editor-in-chief), while hoping someone else will step up and continue the fanzine.

159239.name: Fantasy Chronicles (Issue 2 - Aug 1986)
159239.description:
Fantasy Chronicles
Issue #2
August 1986

Cover art by Jim Fitzpatrick.

159240.name: Business Mogul
159240.description:
In Business Mogul you play as the leader of a rising corporate empire, competing with your peers to amass the most power. Game play is centered around building an economic engine, and uses a bidding mechanic where players must balance bids to get the good stuff and to avoid the bad against the actions needed to build their empire, while saving high bids as much as possible to convert to cash at the end of each season.

The game has a fixed number of turns - six seasons of five rounds each - and total play time tends to be about 2-2.5 hours for 4 people (the game is designed for 3-5, with a solid 2-player variant), on par with a feature movie. In every round there is one card per player up for grabs - every player gets a card every round. The cards on which players bid are businesses that are used to build up your economic engine, extra actions to be saved until needed most (and they let a player do some things outside the normal rules of play), special agenda cards that give score a bonus at the end of the game (how much depends on how well the conditions for the given card are fulfilled), and bad events (which are to be avoided if possible).

Players are bidding pick order rather than on a particular item. Each players uses a set nine of bidding cards (getting them all back at the start of each season), which represent how the player is dividing their attention that round between trying to get the best of the available items and getting other stuff done. Each bid has a specific action that it allows (lower bids have more powerful actions), and bids saved for the end of the season are worth extra money - the higher the bid the more it’s worth. These additional aspects associated with each bid, the action and the end-of-season cash value, make for exciting, meaningful choices every round.

Business Mogul supports multiple valid strategies, though the highest final score usually goes to the player that dabbles in additional strategies beyond their primary one. The key to winning is being tactically smart about balancing pick order vs action vs end-of-season-payout, paying attention to the state of other player’s empires and the bids they've already used in the current season, and executing a strategy that adapts to the flow of items up for bid.

There are some fairly common game mechanics/attributes that Mogul specifically does not have:

- It has no player-to-player aggression - the bidding each round is the only point of direct competition.
- It does not have random action outcomes (that is whether or not a given action succeeds is not determined by dice, card draw, or anything like that).
- It does not have any kind of territory control.
- It has no resources / production beyond money and end-game score.
- It does not require memorization of what’s been played; aside from a single hidden card each player gets at the start and the particular bid a player is making in a given round, the state of the game is fully revealed.

159243.description:
Back of the book:

1945, GERMANY... the heart of Germany is threatened by the remorseless advance of Allied armies from the east and west. From the borders of France, Belgium and Holland, US and British armies fight their way through the West Wall and on to the river Rhine, then over it and into Germany's industrial heartlands. In Poland, the unstoppable tide of the Red Army sweeps across the Vistula river and strikes for the Oder, beyond which lies the ultimate objective - Berlin, and the final bitter battles of the Second World War in Europe.

BACKGROUND
A general history of the war from Germany's borders to the streets of Cologne, Konigsberg, Bremen and Berlin, covering the period from January 1945 to the ultimate defeat of the Third Reich in May.

ARMY LISTS
Four army lists designed to play with the character of the principal combatants: German 'Defenders of the Reich', to create the ad hoc battlegroups thrown to fight the invasion. These scratch units, mixing a few veteran survivors with Volksturm and armed civilians, must face the power of Russian, British and American armoured spearheads as they drive ever deeper into Germany.

Also game data for all the late war tanks, guns and equipment.

SPECIAL RULES
New special rules to adapt core Battlegroup game to the battlefields of 1945. The rules recreate the desperate last stand nature of much of the fighting in 1945 whilst retaining game balance, despite the German Army's collapsing morale. Special rules include a new battle counters set as well as new innovations like jet fighters and infra-red sights.

SCENARIOS
Four new general scenarios, including an 'Urban Assault' and a mini-campaign 'Breakthrough to Berlin', of six linked historical refights set on the Seelow Heights.
159243.name: Battlegroup Fall of the Reich

159244.name: Fat Cat Far Trader (Revised Edition)
159244.description:
From the back of the book:

Built by the trillium Industrial Group, the tpt-133 logistics transport is a common sight in the Versis Principalities. Their stylish, functional lines, combined with the outstanding quality and craftsmanship displayed in their construction, makes them popular throughout Foreven and the surrounding sectors, even after decades of service.

Learn more about this versatile starship: whether you are looking for a well-used workhorse for your merchant crew, or a brand new hull with customized equipment and interiors to be a corporate executive's plaything; the Fat Cat is the ship you've been waiting for. Equipped with eight double staterooms and capable of carry a hundred tons of cargo in its yard configuration, the fat cat also boasts three hardpoints, a 4-ton orbital raft, and a bridge that is (almost controversially) luxurious.

Nearly a full year in development, this book aims to "raise the bar" among Traveller's third-party publishers. Inside, you'll find full technical and gameplay specs, along with detailed deckplans, background information, and amazing illustrations. It was the support of players like you that sent this book to the printers, and helped us earn the distinction of being the first starship supplement licensed for use with Marc Miller's Traveller5. We are giving gaming in the far future a new look; a level of detail never thought possible. I hope you enjoy the ride.

159245.name: Block Party
159245.description:
Block Party is a game that delights and challenges active minds. Players race to find patterns of icons called Parties. Parties are highly symmetric collections of icons which tickle the brain. With simple shapes and pleasing colors, Block Party brings out your playful side and gets your wheels spinning from the first "Party!"

Features gameplay borrowing attribute matching mechanics like those found in Set and Qwirkle, a tiny number of components (can be played with only 8 wooden blocks), and dozens of variations to vary the game duration, number of players, cooperation or competition, and age range (easier variations for young players and harder ones for masters).

How to Play: Block Party Classic

Block Party can be played with 1-6 players for as long as they like. Players simultaneously search for parties (symmetric collections of four icons, see below for more), shouting "Party!" when they find one, after which they put it together to show the group and flip the four blocks used.

For a more finite and competitive version, players can keep score (often with tokens or Block Party cards) where the first player to 10 parties wins. This number can be changed to alter the duration of the game, or set per player to handicap and make for a fair race.

159246.name: Rock Science: Festival
159246.description:
Rock Science: Festival is a travel version of rock and metal trivia game Rock Science. The game covers hundreds of bands, from Classic Rock to Nu Metal via Trash Metal and many others.

Players compete to collect most point chips through answering questions. Question categories include rockers, albums and songs, and players may also be asked to hum riffs. All questions have three different difficulty levels - the higher difficulty a player chooses, the higher the possible reward in point chips. Other important game mechanics are betting (you constantly bet on the knowledge of co-players).

The game includes question cards (around 800 questions in total), die, point/betting chips and rules.

159247.name: Robot Wars
159247.description:
Find out which robot in the Robosphere has what it takes with this custom paper-crafting kit! Flex your crafting muscles and create 10 easy-to-assemble robots, each with their own personality and fighting style. Pair up any two 'bots to battle head-to-head by placing each atop the included motorized wheel bases. See who knocks the other off the fighting ring first, and keep score on the Robodrome's scoreboard. This kit also features your very own Robot Wars Combat Manual with fun background stories and directions on how to construct each rough-and-tumble machine.

Kit includes full-color templates to construct 10 paper-craft robots, 2 wind-up wheel frames, deluxe fighting ring with scoreboards, and a step-by-step instruction book complete with details on each robot's personality.

159248.description:
The Chase is played on a square wooden board with a round pit, the "hideout," carved out of the center. Four lines of small holes extend vertically and horizontally from the pit to the sides of the board, and continue around all four sides making a border. Near each corner of the board are four more small holes. Printed on the board over the lines of small holes are the outlines of footprints leading in one direction, ultimately towards the hideout. Printed over the groupings of four holes are a bomb, a noose, a gun, and a knife.

Four players have four pegs each in their own color. Play begins with their four pieces resting in one of the four corner groupings. Players take turns rolling a six-sided die to determine the length of their move. Any one of the player's pegs may be moved, but most be moved the exact number of footprints rolled on the die.

If landing on a hole occupied by another player, the first peg is returned to its home base to begin again, and the peg in play is moved five extra spaces. Players may not land on a footprint occupied by one of their own pegs; they must choose to move a different peg.

The hideout may only be reached by an exact roll of the die. If no other moves are possible, that player forfeits the turn and the peg remains in place. The first player to move all four pegs into the hideout wins the game.
159248.name: The Chase

159250.name: Super Bis: Deutsch
159250.description:
Super Bis is pretty simple language learning game. The game comprises of two decks of cards (one deck of questions and one deck of answers). For every question card, there is just one matching answer card. There is also one joker and one jack-in-the box -card. There is two rule sets in the game.

In the first game you just deal out the cards. Joker is removed. Everybody then removes matching pairs from their hands. Then the player in turn takes a card from the previous player. If the card matches a card in the players hand, he/she reads it loud and removes the pair. Then it's next players turn. This goes on until cards run out. Winner is the player who gets rid of his/her cards first and the loser is the player holding the pairless jack-in-the-box when pairs run out.

In the other game you just deal out the question cards. Joker and the jack-in-the-box are removed. Answer cards are shuffled and put in the table. One player then turns up the first card from the answers deck and reads it out. The player with the matching question reads it and then discards it. Then you read out the next answer card. Winner is the player who first gets rid of his/her cards.

159251.name: Don't Tip the Waiter
159251.description:
Objective: be the first one getting rid of all your pieces
- acting by turns -
Each player at the start of the game has a set of pieces in one colour. Two dice direct a.) the tray & b.) how many playing pieces must be placed on the waiters’ trays.
Playing pieces may be placed in any order except for the coffee pot and the cheese dish which must be the last items.
The six waiters are positioned in such a way that as one falls, the next waiter may also tumble. Dropped pieces must be taken of whatever colour and add them to your own.

Note:
This is not the same game as Don't Tip the Waiter, Don't Tip the Waiter or Don't Tip The Waiter.

159252.name: Terror Island
159252.description:
From the back cover:

You've been marooned on Bounty Island, home of the most sinister corporation on earth: Omicron. The Omicron Masters have discovered the secrets of mind control and genetic mutation- and they're about to take over the world. It's up to you to stop them- but how will you do it?

I you decide to search the Omicron vaults for secret datea, turn to page 98. If you decide to hunt down the Omicron leader instead, turn to page 103. Beware! The Omicron Masters re fiends. If they catch you, you could be devoured by mutant rats or frozen in a vat of liquid helium. Or you might find a way to destroy Omicron- and save the world!

What happens next in the story? It all depends on the choices YOU make. How does the story end? Only YOU can find out! And the best part is that you can keep reading and rereading until you've had not one, but many incredibly daring experiences.

159253.name: Freelance Traveller (Issue 53 - May 2014)
159253.description:
From the Contents page:

Freelance Traveller #053: May 2014

Cover: Brian Ronnle

Freelance Traveller is published monthly in PDF form by the editor. The current issue is available from Freelance Traveller's web site.

159254.name: Samurai
159254.description:
From publisher blurb:

One of the great strengths of the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game is that it provides players with so many options for their characters. Yet that very strength can also be a source of confusion for new players and casual gamers. For folks who have school, careers, family, and other activities, the seemingly simple task of creating a character and periodically leveling up can feel like a serious commitment rather than a fun pastime.

You're not a "dummy". You're not a "complete idiot". But you could use a guide, so you can just sit down with your friends and play Pathfinder. Each 48 page Character Workbook was created with the time-crunched player in mind. It is intended to help those unfamiliar with the system, yet want to make a character that is perfect for them, filter out the things that may not apply and zero in on only the abilities that are relevant to their character Class. It also serves as a level-by-level guide to character advancement, reminding even experienced players what needs to be changed and what decisions need to be made when "leveling up".

159255.name: Ninja
159255.description:
From publisher blurb:

One of the great strengths of the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game is that it provides players with so many options for their characters. Yet that very strength can also be a source of confusion for new players and casual gamers. For folks who have school, careers, family, and other activities, the seemingly simple task of creating a character and periodically leveling up can feel like a serious commitment rather than a fun pastime.

You're not a "dummy". You're not a "complete idiot". But you could use a guide, so you can just sit down with your friends and play Pathfinder. Each 48 page Character Workbook was created with the time-crunched player in mind. It is intended to help those unfamiliar with the system, yet want to make a character that is perfect for them, filter out the things that may not apply and zero in on only the abilities that are relevant to their character Class. It also serves as a level-by-level guide to character advancement, reminding even experienced players what needs to be changed and what decisions need to be made when "leveling up".

159256.name: Tarina, Spiral of Sin
159256.description:
From publisher blurb:

Tarina, the Black Pearl of Tar Sequinus, home to pirates, corrupt senators, smugglers, the Five Families and a teaming jungle of intrigue and violence. Founded atop the ruins of an ancient elven settlement thousands of years ago, conquered by the Tar Sequin Empire a scant few generations ago, Tarina is the bustling home of some 140,000 denizens of every race, class, background and variety. It is also home to some of the most powerful and infamous crime families of the Empire and all who would profit from their dealings. What ancient hidden wonders will this city offer up? What dark alley and back room deals will be made in the shadow of marbled temples? What adventures await amid the jungle ruins at the borders of the elven homelands? Will heroes become conquerors or slaves?

Tarina, Spiral of Sin provides the first detailed guide to one of the seedier cities of the Shadowlands campaign setting, the perfect setting between jungle adventures or setting of an entire urban campaign. Inside you’ll find:

Exceptionally rendered aerial “satellite” maps of the city, the regions controlled by the crime families, and detailed descriptions of major monuments, palaces, fortresses, and places of interest.
Descriptions of Tarina’s most powerful influencers, from senators, information brokers, noble knights and heads of criminal cartels, a rich tapestry of plots, intrigue, and ideas to feed an entire campaign and more.
A dozen new regional traits, detailed notes on the races and classes in and around Tarina, new racial powers.
A new prestige class, the Knight of Kashouli, complete with all the background for running these noble knights in the black heart of the jungle.
Complete listing of local regional gods, their domains and influences, so you can play a native divinely graced caster.
New fiction by Shadowlands writer Ben Cacchione and a new installment in the adventures of the shadowy Lucius.

159257.name: Alluria Campaign Setting Guide (Pathfinder)
159257.description:
From publisher blurb:


Get the best of all worlds!

This is not a stand-alone campaign setting—it is a setting upon which material from your entire library of campaign settings can be applied. The Alluria Campaign Setting Guide works as a framework upon which eclectic Game Masters can build a widely diverse world. It provides a backdrop in which multiple worlds intermingle, characters that would not normally interact do, and culture is no longer a barrier. Best of all, it ties in all of the unique and wonderful creatures of Alluria Publishing’s Remarkable Races line with all of the most popular core races. So if you want a fun and interesting way to explain why your party’s android alchemist, drow ninja, and entobian ranger happen to be adventuring together, pick up the Alluria Campaign Setting Guide today!

NOTE: This is the 5th anniversary edition of this tome. The Alluria Campaign Setting was our flagship product, mostly abandoned after we decided to focus on the Pathfinder Roleplaying System and the Cerulean Seas setting. For our five year anniversary, our first tome has been updated from its original with a conversion from 4th Edition Dungeons & Dragons to the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game system. However, the original formatting was preserved to demonstrate how far Alluria Publishing has come in the last half-decade. While the content and art are still top notch, the format and layout are quite primitive by our current publishing standards, but still very enjoyable.

159258.name: A Player's Guide: The Colonies
159258.description:
From publisher blurb:

Shadows over Vathak: Colonies - Player's Guide

Welcome to the world of Shadows over Vathak, a realm where the abominations known as the Old Ones seek to destroy humanity. It is a world of darkness and despair, where even the light of the One True God is often corrupted and twisted to serve sinister ends. As players, you may be heroes representing a bright point of light in the encroaching shadows of evil or you might just be survivors, living day by day however you can, survival your only goal. In Vathak, even joy is mingled with the bitter ashes of despair and hopelessness.

What you have here are additional player options to augment the material presented in the Shadows over Vathak Campaign Guide. New feats, spells, traits, and more are detailed in the pages of this book, tied to one of the specific regions of Vathak. That is not to say that just because your character hails from elsewhere or you are campaigning in a different part of Vathak, that you cannot use the material in this book. While the material here in is based on a specific region, it is also designed to fit the overall themes of Shadows over Vathak as a whole. As always, check with your GM before using any of the options in this book to make sure they are comfortable with it and it fits the flavor of the campaign.

159259.name: Equipment Cards Volume I
159259.description:
From publisher blurb:

The first set of cards designed for use with the Mutant Future game created by Goblinoid Games, though easily adaptable to other OCR type game systems for sci-fi or sci-fantasy type settings. The Print and Play PDF consists of four face sheets, four backing sheets (alternating) with the face sheets consisting of six cards each. Also, the PDF version consists of Adobe layers and a full color version, greyscale version, and black and white version can be generated from the same file.

159260.name: Hall of the Dwarf Lords
159260.description:
From publisher blurb:

Getting there is half the fun?

The town of Timel is suffering under a plague and the townspeople need the cure that Havendale has! The safest way to Timel is through the Dorgel Mountains where the Hammerskin Dwarves operate some kind of system that allows for faster travel. Hopefully the Dwarves will allow you to get to Timel faster!

This adventure can be played with a group of adventurers of 2nd - 4th levels.

This adventure setting was designed for 1st/2nd Edition AD&D for the Filbar Campaign, however it is easily adaptable to most any game and system. Save yourself some time and utilize it for a one shot adventure or a continuing campaign!

159261.name: Liberation of Irongate
159261.description:
From publisher blurb:

Who is up for a little mini-wargaming!!

Tragedy has struck the Dwarven Kingdom of the Hammerskin Clan. Recent quakes have opened the Dwarven mines to a humanoid invasion that have taken over the Stonegate and Irongate sections of the kingdom. On your last foray into the Dorgel Mountains you were tasked to deliver a plague cure for the town of Timel. On your way through the trade route you discovered the invasion and fought your way through to deliver the remedy. Now you must return to help the Dwarves secure their domain!

This adventure is suitable for groups of levels 2nd - 4th. This adventure gives players the opportunity to be part of a large scale battle in small managable encounters with the potential of EXPLOSIVE results!

This adventure setting was designed for 1st/2nd Edition AD&D for the Filbar Campaign, however it is easily adaptable to most any game and system. Save yourself some time and utilize it for a one shot adventure or a continuing campaign!

159262.name: Euriduis of Santos
159262.description:
From publisher blurb:

The caravan master Santos Boromite was personally assaulted and his Euriduis, the symbol of caravan power, was stolen. The item signifies full authority over all legs of the caravan and in the wrong hands would wreak havoc. You have been summoned to speak with the Governor Lando Shardo at once to save Timel yet again! Can you find the bandits responsible for the theft and bring them to justice. Timel wants a caravan traffic and unless this matter is taken care of quickly that won't happen. Just when you think you have it figured it out it turns out you were wrong!

This adventure is suitable for adventure groups of level 4-6. This adventure setting was designed for 1st/2nd Edition AD&D for the Filbar Campaign, however it is easily adaptable to most any game and system. Save yourself some time and utilize it for a one shot adventure or a continuing campaign!

159263.name: Challenge of the Minotaur
159263.description:
From publisher blurb:

Near the Southern end of the Border Hills between Gortelburg and Havendale is an area rumored to be the home of a Minotaur. Recent reports have begun to surface in Havendale of the surrounding farms and villages that a huge Minotaur has begun to disrupt life in the area. The governing board of Havendale has offered a bounty on the beast to anyone who can track it, kill it, and return proof of its demise. Quite a few parties of adventurers have taken up the task but none have returned for the reward.

This adventure is suitable for adventure groups of level 4-6.

This adventure setting was designed for 1st/2nd Edition AD&D for the Filbar Campaign, however it is easily adaptable to most any game and system. Save yourself some time and utilize it for a one shot adventure or a continuing campaign!

159264.name: Grotto of Torla Mir
159264.description:
From publisher blurb:

Your group has been requested by Archbishop Telamor Constran from the Church of Koassak to go on a rescue mission for one of his missing brothers who was taken by pirates. You have been enlisted because of your growing fame to barter a release out of the Pirate Lord Hannibal the Black. After three days of storms you awake to a really bad sound....Abandon Ship!

This adventure is part of the Filbar series and it is suitable for a group of adventurers of 4th through 6th level. While part of the Filbar realm it is easily adaptable to any campaign and most systems. While this is a short and seemingly easy adventure, once you understand most of your armor is at the bottom of the sea floor things aren't as easy as you would think!

159265.name: Quest for the Golden Rose
159265.description:
From publisher blurb:

Off the Coast of Clover Island and less than a league away from FT11: Corsair Bay is the wreck of the Golden Rose a ship of fame. The Tome Lord from Corsair Bay is looking for a few brave adventurers to go out, find the ship or what remains of it and locate a specific item for him. While the mysterious sage won’t explain what the item is he will tell you that it is protected by mighty magical glyphs of protection so simply obtain the box and bring it to him for the reward. Rumor has it the ship was laden with a great deal of treasure which is free for the party’s taking but the Tome Lord wants the box. Is your party up for a little underwater jaunt?

This adventure setting was designed for 1st/2nd Edition AD&D for the Filbar Campaign for a mid-level to high level adventuring party. This adventure is easily adaptable to most any game and system. Save yourself some time and utilize it for a one shot adventure or a continuing campaign!

159266.name: Priory of Enyndeth
159266.description:
From publisher blurb:

A small valley in the Basalt Mountains is home to a small farming community and a priory for the deity Enyndeth. Here young acolytes study to be full-fledged clerics of their faith. The priory was built into the side of one of the mountains when the community specialized in mining. This town should be able to provide road weary adventurers a reprieve from problems….or will it?

This adventure setting was designed for 1st/2nd Edition AD&D for the Filbar Campaign for a mid-level group of adventurers. This adventure is easily adaptable to most any game and system. Save yourself some time and utilize it for a one shot adventure or a continuing campaign!

159267.name: Prison of Oxidosus
159267.description:
From publisher blurb:

As your party closes in on the coast of the Newmack Sea you are greeted by a large group of the duke’s military. After gaining an audience with General Zulta you discover that your reputation has preceded you. The general asks your party if they could assist him in the capture of the rogue mage Oxidosus who is currently trapped in his island fortress. A cautionary note, if the players make poor decisions TPK is a very real possibility!

This adventure setting was designed for 1st/2nd Edition AD&D for the Filbar Campaign for a mid to upper level group of adventurers. This adventure is easily adaptable to most any game and system. Save yourself some time and utilize it for a one shot adventure or a continuing campaign!

159268.name: Necropolis of Sutama
159268.description:
From publisher blurb:

A cemetary is nice but an entire city of the dead.....THAT'S an adventure. At 29 pages this adventure a large number of challenges for a party of higher levels. Set in the famed Adurite city of the dead this adventure offers many challenges to a party. What lies within? What treasures may be found? This adventure is not for the faint of heart. With over ten area maps and multiple pictures of areas the party may find, this is a full adventure. Are your players ready for a big adventure?

This adventure is suitable for adventure groups of level 6-10.

This adventure setting was designed for 1st/2nd Edition AD&D for the Filbar Campaign, however it is easily adaptable to most any game and system. Save yourself some time and utilize it for a one shot adventure or a continuing campaign!

159269.name: Bog of Jelaneus
159269.description:
From publisher blurb:

A cemetary is nice but an entire city of the dead.....THAT'S an adventure. At 29 pages this adventure a large number of challenges for a party of higher levels. Set in the famed Adurite city of the dead this adventure offers many challenges to a party. What lies within? What treasures may be found? This adventure is not for the faint of heart. With over ten area maps and multiple pictures of areas the party may find, this is a full adventure. Are your players ready for a big adventure?

This adventure is suitable for adventure groups of level 6-10.

This adventure setting was designed for 1st/2nd Edition AD&D for the Filbar Campaign, however it is easily adaptable to most any game and system. Save yourself some time and utilize it for a one shot adventure or a continuing campaign!

159270.name: Fens of Malack
159270.description:
From publisher blurb:

This setting is a collective of different area encounters for several different character levels. While this land was a frequently travelled area for the adventurers it was used for a variety of challenges. While not every challenge is met for every level it is up to the PCs to decide if they are up for the challenge they discover. Of course you can always ‘discourage’ or hide some encounters from the party. It can also be used in an area frequented by the PC party that can offer an increased challenge with each visit they make.

This adventure setting was designed for 1st/2nd Edition AD&D for the Filbar Campaign for an initial to low level group of adventurers. This adventure is easily adaptable to most any game and system. Save yourself some time and utilize it for several one shot adventures or a continuing campaign setting!

159271.name: Springwood Forest
159271.description:
From publisher blurb:

This setting has been used as a bridge for the F and the FN series as it runs along the border north of Feastelburg. While this adventure setting is a collective of areas to adventure it does feature the locations of two Filbar uploads. The Sunken Temple of Bulu and the Elven village of FT10: Silvantri are both located in this area. Of course there are other areas to explore such as the Centaur settlement, Pixies, and even a mad mage for flavor.

This adventure setting was designed for 1st/2nd Edition AD&D for the Filbar Campaign for any level group of adventurers. This adventure is easily adaptable to most any game and system. Save yourself some time and utilize it for several one shot adventures or a continuing campaign setting!

159272.name: Turret of the Frost Giant
159272.description:
From publisher blurb:

The free adventure for December is the Turret of the Frost Giant. It is an adventure designed to interrupt a party of adventurers who are going from point A to point B. on a message delivery assignment. While on the mission the party runs into a blizzard, pack of wolves, and a rogue band of humanoids attempting a roadblock! Can your party deal with this growing problem and survive?

This adventure is for a group of 4th - 6th level adventurers set in the land of Filbar. This adventure can be modified to fit any campaign setting and can be used as a fill in adventure.

159273.name: Slaughter at Sengais
159273.description:
From publisher blurb:

After a few scrapes with adventure even novice heroes will need a break and such is the case with this challenge. The young group of PCs will find themselves entering a backwater burg in the hopes of a little R&R (rest and relaxation) but as they come close to town a dead body in the road and the smell of burning foreshadows troubling times ahead. The R&R will have to wait as the young adventurers will be challenged yet again.

This adventure setting was designed for 1st/2nd Edition AD&D for the Filbar Campaign for a low level group of adventurers. This adventure is easily adaptable to most any game and system. Save yourself some time and utilize it for a one shot adventure or a continuing campaign!

159274.name: Golem of the Adurites
159274.description:
From publisher blurb:

The 50th installment of Adventures in Filbar brings you FC3 – Golem of the Adurites. Frequent visitors know that the Adurite culture once ruled a large portion of the known world but has now all but disappeared. In this adventure a relic Golem that guards a shrine has been duped and gone on a rampage. This adventure was originally created for a “filler” adventure on a day when the entire party could not adventure. Spoiler alert the Golem is not the worst thing the party will face! At 29 pages this adventure has a little bit of everything.

This adventure setting was designed for 1st/2nd Edition AD&D for the Filbar Campaign for a higher level group of adventurers. This adventure is easily adaptable to most any game and system. Save yourself some time and utilize it for several one shot adventures or a continuing campaign setting!

159275.name: Adventures in Filbar I
159275.description:
From publisher blurb:

This supplement gives background information on Filbar for those who want to immerse themselves in the world. Contained within this 28 page compilation are several stories, documentation on a few magical items, the deity listing used in Filbar, and information on current and future titles!

While based in Filbar, this information can be easily injected into other campaign settings.

159276.name: Trouble in Durwall Valley
159276.description:
From publisher blurb:

For years the Count of Durwall Keep ruled over the land fairly and with justice. That ended during the Bloodrayne Conflict when the castle was felled by troops loyal to General Bloodrayne. In the many years that followed the triangular keep has fallen into a sordid state of disrepair. The keep used to hold mighty coffers of treasure for the Count and for the Emperor as well. A stronghold was built under the keep to secure said treasure and perhaps some treasure may still remain in the depths of its dungeons. Recently it’s been said that the Snaggletooth tribe of kobolds has seized the fortress and is using it as their home. It is also rumored that there may still be undiscovered treasure located in the dungeon of the keep. Faint echoes of the missing Orb of Ruler ship are still heard.

This adventure is suitable for adventure groups of level 1-3.

This adventure setting was designed for 1st/2nd Edition AD&D for the Filbar Campaign, however it is easily adaptable to most any game and system. Save yourself some time and utilize it for a one shot adventure or a continuing campaign!

159277.name: Eye of Gruumsh
159277.description:
From publisher blurb:

With your first set of adventures firmly under your belt you are relaxing and basking in the glory of a job well done. While at the local tavern imbibing in some well-earned spirits, a commotion can be heard outside. As you step outside the villagers are pampering two children who apparently just rode into town on a very sweaty and tired pony. An arrow is sticking out of the mount’s flank. As the animal is removed the townspeople pepper the children with questions as both are obviously afraid. It would appear the drinks will have to wait.

This adventure setting was designed for 1st/2nd Edition AD&D for the Filbar Campaign; however it is easily adaptable to most any game and system. Save yourself some time and utilize it for a one shot adventure or a continuing campaign! It was designed for a group of adventurers of 2nd - 4th level.

159278.name: Warrens of the Trog King
159278.description:
From publisher blurb:

Local farmers have been coming into Feastelburg recently recounting harrowing stories of a growing number of attacks upon the land. Farmers and travelers have decidedly noted that the creatures causing the problems are troglodytes. The creatures seem to be becoming bolder in their attacks as initially they were at night under cover of darkness. The last several attacks have occurred during daylight and the recent reports have included chasing down and murdering farmers and pilgrims alike. Several farms have been put to the torch and it has the town on edge.

This adventure is suitable for adventure groups of level 3-5.

This adventure setting was designed for 1st/2nd Edition AD&D for the Filbar Campaign, however it is easily adaptable to most any game and system. Save yourself some time and utilize it for a one shot adventure or a continuing campaign!

159279.name: Recovery of the Intrepid
159279.description:
From publisher blurb:

"Yea I knows of a job for the likes of you" the bartender says as he wipes off the table. "This wizard who lives near the shore about two or three days ride lost somethin' he was expected on the ship The Intrepid. I hear he wants the cargo back and is willing to pay good coin for it to any who'd chance going into the Lake of Chaos." A grizzled old man in the corner gasps and says “any would want to go into that sea gots to be crazy. Aye, that wizard is lookin' for some crazy people. That waters haunted by dead sailors". "Oh come on” Telkall the bartender continues "you know that’s just an old story to keep kids away from the water. I'm sure it’s going to be an easy job for the likes you. You all appear to be quite able to take care of yourself. Go down the coast road for about two days if yer on horses and you'll see a stone tower. Ask for Kresellus ... he's the one you'll be lookin' for. Oh, and tell him Wolfgar sent ya ... if you could." Well things were getting boring at the Dead Orc Inn anyway.

This adventure is for characters of 3rd-6th level which was made for the Filbar Campaign but is easily adaptable to any campaign and most systems!

159280.name: The Holdfist Caverns
159280.description:
From publisher blurb:

The humanoids of the north are preparing to attack! Reports of large gatherings of evil creatures are coming in near the Holdfist Mountains. With more and more verified reports coming in something needs to be done quickly. With your fame firmly intact the people have asked your group to once again save the day....are you ready for your next challenge?

Ya know....wasn't there an old castle around here somewhere?

This adventure was designed for use in the Filbar North campaign based on Ad&d 1st/2nd edition but is easily adaptable to any version of RPG in any campaign. This adventure is best used for PCs of 4th - 6th levels.

159281.name: Sunken Temple of Bulu
159281.description:
From publisher blurb:

Tillius Morganstein aka the Mad Mage has selected your group to investigate an ancient temple hidden below the peaceful waters of Lake Springwood. The wizard is too old to investigate the area himself and has enlisted your help. While he has studied the ancient texts dedicated to "Bulu" he cannot define what dangers may lurk or what treasures may await those brave enough to delve into the submerged halls but surely the rewards will be great!

This adventure is suitable for adventure groups of level 4-6.

This adventure setting was designed for 1st/2nd Edition AD&D for the Filbar Campaign, however it is easily adaptable to most any game and system. Save yourself some time and utilize it for a one shot adventure or a continuing campaign!

159282.name: Abbey of Sobek
159282.description:
From publisher blurb:

With your fame building in the Great Plains of Dorack you have received word of an abandoned temple that has been showing signs of life. Years ago the followers of the old deity Sobek built a temple to honor him. The cult died out after a successful raid by Plainsmen who looted the complex after killing off the monks who inhabited it. A few days after the temple sacking the chieftain responsible for the attack fell ill and died of a mysterious disease. As it was believed a curse befell the warlord, the area was abandoned and considered taboo. Lately strange lights have been seen near the old temple and a giant stone alligator has been spotted in the area. The Plainsmen cannot go to the area as the old taboo is still in place and have asked your party to investigate.

This adventure setting was designed for 1st/2nd Edition AD&D for the Filbar Campaign for a mid-level adventurers and a DM. This adventure is easily adaptable to most any game and system. Save yourself some time and utilize it for a one shot adventure or a continuing campaign!

159283.name: Forstal's Final Rest
159283.description:
From publisher blurb:

Decades ago a group of adventurers saved the town of Logan’s Bluff from a humanoid incursion. While the battle ended in a victory, the cost was high when the party lost a valued member of their group. In his honor his comrades and grateful citizens built a tomb over his final resting spot. In the decades since the battle peace has reigned but has recently waned with the advent of more humanoid sightings. Some have wondered if Forstal’s tomb is drawing the humanoids back for revenge.

This adventure setting was designed for 1st/2nd Edition AD&D for the Filbar Campaign for a low level group of adventurers. This adventure is easily adaptable to most any game and system. Save yourself some time and utilize it for a one shot adventure or a continuing campaign! Written in the early 90’s this isn’t as polished as current work but still an excellent ‘filler’ adventure!

159284.name: Conquest of Ironrod Tower
159284.description:
From publisher blurb:

The local nobles of the region have sent word to your group requesting a meeting. Later that day you find the Black Raven roadside tavern and are met at the door. After being escorted to a back room which has seen its share of shady dealings you are propositioned with an offer to investigate and depose a set of local nobles who are brothers. Rumor has it that the Ironrod brothers, who have been overtaxing the citizens, have now employed humanoids as guards. This is forbidden and if true, the brothers need to be brought to justice immediately!

This adventure is part of my 'original' series and has been used as a filler or side trek adventure. It is suitable for a group of adventurers of 2nd through 4th level. While part of the Filbar realm it is easily adaptable to any campaign and most systems.

159285.name: The Thane's Crypt
159285.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Thane’s Crypt is one of my original adventures created a very long time ago. That being said it has been dusted off and revamped a bit for an interesting solo adventure for a low level or novice PC. A fortress fell to the forces of nature decades ago and the dungeon entrance has recently been discovered by a shepherd. It pits the PC against other parties who have found the crypt area to find the fabled Amulet of Akar which is said to possess magical qualities. Can your fledgling PC brave the depths and come out a hero?

This adventure setting was designed for 1st/2nd Edition AD&D for the Filbar Campaign for a single low level adventurer and a DM. This adventure is easily adaptable to most any game and system. Save yourself some time and utilize it for a one shot adventure or a continuing campaign!

159286.name: Yasmine's Tower
159286.description:
From publisher blurb:

Deep in a secluded vale is a place known to the locals as Yasmine's Tower. It is said that she is an evil witch who uses magic to bend lost travellers to her will. Can your party put an end to this evil?

This adventure is for beginning levels and can be incorporated into any campaign setting or used with additional adventures in the Filbar realm as a continuing campaign. Also this is set near the Free City of Landos and which can be used as a companion adventure!

159287.name: Under Castle Modum
159287.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Adurite Empire ruled most of the area centuries ago due in no small part to its chain of mighty fortresses. Chief among these bastions was the formidable Castle Modum. This ancient refuge was said to hold mighty magic which may or may not have been the downfall to the castle. Long abandoned the area has always been rumored to house spectral forces and evil creatures. Recently strange lights have been spotted over the keep and the citizens are concerned that an ancient magic has been awakened. The call has come to your ears that adventure awaits….are you ready?

This adventure is based in the Filbar Campaign using 1st/2nd AD&D edition rules but can be modified for most campaigns and settings. It was designed for 1st – 4th level characters but can be adapted according to the composition of the party.

159288.name: Cabal of Sukits
159288.description:
From publisher blurb:

With rumors of disappearances running rampant in the area, your group comes into the small community of Morla Dale with more questions than answers. Several wanted posters during your journey have shown a criminal called Sukits the Butcher. Perhaps this strange individual is behind the abductions?

This adventure was designed for a group of adventurers of levels 2nd-4th. While designed for the Filbar campaign it can be modified to fit most any campaign or can be used as a one shot adventure.

159289.name: Butchery of the Geldamore
159289.description:
From publisher blurb:

There your party is, having a few pints at the local tavern, minding your own business.....suddenly a fight breaks out! As you enjoy watching someone else take a beating for once, the town guards break in and stop the fight. A shriek and an old woman pointing her finger at one of the members of your party saying they have murdered the bar owner and now they are in custody. Can the other members of the party figure out the mystery and spring your cohort?

This adventure is a murder mystery for adventurers of any level and can be incorporated into any campaign setting or used with additional adventures in the Filbar realm as a continuing campaign. Also this is set in the Free City of Landos and can be used as a companion adventure!

159290.name: Raiders at Fargone
159290.description:
From publisher blurb:

Coming off the Plains of Dorack, you enter the Glockenspiel Mountains, where the remote village of Fargone is located. A merchant caravan you encountered a few days ago mentioned that Fargone residents have discovered a pass through the mountains to the sea; and a new trade route is opening up. This sounds like a nice place to stop before venturing to the sea! As you approach the area where Fargone is said to be, large billowing smoke clouds can be seen….this could be problematic…..

Raiders at Fargone was designed for 1st/2nd Edition AD&D for the Filbar Campaign, however it is easily adaptable to most any game and system. This adventure was designed for a party of 5th through 8th level characters. Save yourself some time and utilize it for a one shot adventure or a continuing campaign! This is the precursor to Odie's Staff.

159291.name: Odie's Staff
159291.description:
From publisher blurb:

This adventure has it all for an upper level group of players. With the rumor of a lost wizards staff on an island, the chase is on to find this powerful piece of magic. Arrival on the island leads off in over three directions and each path has a different set of challenges and rewards. Can your party locate the staff?

This adventure is part of the Filbar series and it is suitable for a group of adventurers of 7th through 10th level. While part of the Filbar realm it is easily adaptable to any campaign and most systems.

159292.name: Fortitude Dungeon
159292.description:
From publisher blurb:

Need to teach a newbie how to play?

A young village shepherd has been telling a tale of an opening in the ground near where his flock roams. Timby Poster thinks he has found something of great importance. He has been telling everyone that there are stone stairs leading into the depths. He was going to investigate but his flock was set upon by vile humanoids that have been raiding the area more frequently. As Timby is prone to tell “tales” of monsters and his flock came back intact this may be a hoax thought up by the young boy.

This adventure was designed for a beginning character with little RPG experience. Created for one player and one DM this allows a new player to understand basic concepts. This adventure was designed for the Filbar Campaign but is easily adaptable to any campaign and most game systems.

159293.name: Tabernacle of the Ka-Sik-Fal
159293.description:
From publisher blurb:

SPECIAL DOUBLE ISSUE!

The Tabernacle of Ka-Sik-Fal is a 2 in 1 adventure including a TRUE SOLO adventure. This double adventure is actually the same adventure in two formats, one DM & PC, and the other a true do it yourself adventure. This adventure is for a PC of 1-3 level . It follows the Filbar Campaign setting but can be placed in any campaign setting.

This adventure takes a single PC into a deserted shrine to discover the whereabouts of missing villagers. At 35 pages this adventure will keep your PC busy. Did I mention a true 1 person solo adventure?

159294.name: Monastery of the White Rose
159294.description:
From publisher blurb:

Two days ago while in the Village of Balis you heard a rumor of an abandoned monastery. With such a deserted location already so close at hand one could not refuse the temptation of checking on its possible gains-whether it is treasure or knowledge that is to say. Yet the gains must surely be worthy of someone as adventurous and brave as yourself. Through further investigation of the rumors of the townspeople you have discovered that the old monastery is said to be haunted with the dead walking the grounds. Directions were located and after a final day’s praying you set out to locate the Monastery of the White Rose.

This adventure takes a single PC into a deserted monastery to discover adventure! This adventure is for a single beginning adventurer or an experienced adventurer who wants to go alone on an adventure.

159295.name: Xavier's Wand
159295.description:
From publisher blurb:

With survival being the hardest thing at low levels it’s important that PCs are careful and find help where they can. Xavier’s Wand offers a fledgling adventurer the opportunity to shine on their own and find a little help on the road as well. This adventure pits your new “hero” up against a bully and other challenges that will bolster a young adventurers experience and pockets! A thorp, humanoids, and potential henchman are some of the encounters in this adventure.

This adventure setting was designed for 1st/2nd Edition AD&D for the Filbar Campaign for a low level/new adventurer and DM. This adventure is easily adaptable to most any game and system. This is adventure is an excellent tool for those new to RPG gameplay. Save yourself some time and utilize it for a one shot adventure or a continuing campaign!

159296.name: Zenobia's Lute
159296.description:
From publisher blurb:

As you move throughout the countryside a rider appears in the distance and begins to close quickly. Hand going to your weapons you ready yourself for danger but notice the rider is very young. Timmy Little introduces himself and warns you of a bout of Goblin-Pox at his village. Many people are sick and need help. Timmy says he and other young people have been sent out to find heroes to save the town and asks if you can help. While the boy cannot provide a great deal of information on the malady he advises you that the people of Troburtandban who aren’t sick can help with information. Once you agree he rides off to find additional help.

This adventure setting was designed for 1st/2nd Edition AD&D for the Filbar Campaign for a low level adventurer and DM. This adventure is easily adaptable to most any game and system. Save yourself some time and utilize it for a one shot adventure or a continuing campaign!

159297.name: Keep of Baron Sancrist
159297.description:
From publisher blurb:

While at times cliché there are few adventures better than an old fashioned trek into the ruins of a deserted castle. This adventure pits a new adventurer against the decades old remains of a hilltop castle that is “haunted”. The old keep was the site of a mighty battle years before that swayed the power in the area but now it is the crumbling remains of the once powerful Baron Sancrist. While the old fortress is supposed to be deserted the area farmers and villagers swear they have seen the dead walk the parapets in the moonlight. Well you wanted adventure….here it comes!

This adventure setting was designed for 1st/2nd Edition AD&D for the Filbar Campaign for a single adventurer and DM. This adventure is easily adaptable to most any game and system. Save yourself some time and utilize it for a one shot adventure or a continuing campaign!

159298.name: A Paladin's Warhorse
159298.description:
From publisher blurb:

Playing a Paladin can be an enjoyable experience especially with their vast array of powers and special abilities. One of their most overlooked abilities is their calling for a bonded mount at 4th level. Several scenarios are available for this "calling" including dreams, quests, etc. in the books but I have yet to run across any published adventures for it. This adventure provides one such option for gaining the mount and utilizing the Paladin's recent ability to turn undead as well. While this is a short adventure, it gives the DM an option to go one on one with a Paladin PC and challenge him/her in order to win their steed and a little glory as well. I hope you enjoy it!

While this adventure is set towards a 1st/2nd edition AD&D for a 4th level Paladin, it can be modified to fit with most games and campaigns. It can also act as a 1st level adventure for a very weak or small numbered party.

159299.name: Water Weird's Wake
159299.description:
From publisher blurb:

This solo adventure is designed as an adventure to teach the PC that sometimes you need help in solving tough problems. The adventurer learns that Ortella the Druid is seeking assistance in obtaining spell components to help the local village. It seems that the community has a magical phantasm causing problems in its lake and they need help in the form of Ortella and Ortella needs your help!

This adventure setting was designed for 1st/2nd Edition AD&D for the Filbar Campaign for a limited experienced solo player. This adventure is easily adaptable to most any game and system. Save yourself some time and utilize it for a one shot adventure or a continuing campaign!

159300.name: Hocus Pocus Land
159300.description:
From publisher blurb:

Ready for Fun?

The cryogenically frozen corpse of a dead cowboy movie star, the lingering spectre of a cartoon tycoon, an amusement park ruled by killer robots, an insane doctor... Are you ready for Hocus-pocus Land?

This adventure for Frankenstein Atomic Frontier, takes your characters to a world of amusement wonders of yesterday. Once upon a time it was the greatest amusement park in the whole damn world. Now it’s a rundown tyrannical kingdom ruled by a sadistic artificial intelligence. Here “playtime” and “God” go hand-in-hand. For Frankenstein Atomic Frontier this book offers:

A full length adventure.
The completely detailed Sublime metropolis of "Hocus-pocus Land" complete with factions and politics.
New Folks and Bad Guys.
A 100% Australian made RPG product!

159301.name: Machine
159301.description:
From publisher blurb:

Rise now, the sons of Asimov!

Cybernetics, synthetic biology, robotic monstrosities - the secrets of the mechanical life unveiled! Machine for Frankenstein Atomic Frontier is a character options supplement, bringing you new Special Parts, Gear and character options based along a “mechanical” theme, designed to bring a peppering of high-tech flair to your post-apocalyptic patchwork western!

Machine boasts:

New Special Parts and Bad Guys.
Gear Parts – a whole new type of Parts for the cybernetic replacement of biological breakdowns.
Killbots as a character option – play the killer robot of tomorrow today!
Is a 100% Australian made RPG product!

159302.name: Bible Wars: the board game
159302.description:
Bible Wars: the board game, takes the tactical level Bible Wars Card Game to the next level.

The game features the same 6 cultures on a strategic map of the Holy Lands. In the game each culture is trying to capture and hold onto 18 territories to win but, it's not easy.

The first player each turn is randomly determined. Combat is determined, not only by who has the most armies, but by terrain and the playing of cultural army cards. The cards give each side an advantage to add to their die roll. Combat can continue several rounds until the attacked retreats or the defender is eliminated. There is no retreat for the defender.

Cultural advantages include Egyptian Chariots, Philistine Giants, Babylonian War Elephants, Israeli Heavenly Interventions, Canaanite Additional Local Forces, and Assyrian Professional Units.

159303.name: Project OSIRIS
159303.description:
From publisher blurb:

Mad Science Mummery!

In a desert land beset by mad science mummery a vicious Marauder leader with delusions of godhood has awakened ancient weapons of war. Now the settlement of Correctional needs you. Get ready to face… Project OSIRIS. For Frankenstein Atomic Frontier this book offers:

A full length adventure.
A completely detailed Settlement good for use in any game of Frankenstein Atomic Frontier.
New Folks and Bad Guys.
A 100% Australian made RPG product!

159304.name: Road Rage
159304.description:
From publisher blurb:

Throughout the Sublime, its angry out there on the road. The Settlement of Broken Rock needs you. Its time to burn rubber in... ROAD RAGE! This adventure for Frankenstein Atomic Frontier boasts:

Free micro-adventure, the perfect start to any campaign!
100% Australian made!

159305.name: Amputation
159305.description:
From publisher blurb:

Mix it up, twist it round, jump that shark… Spare Parts #3 Amputation is a fragment product, based on experimental variations of the Frankenstein Atomic Frontier system, drawn from on cancelled and previously unpublished materials. Each variation and the background presented here ready to add to your games. Spare Parts #3 boasts:

Steampunk short story background.
New and variant rules such as social class and wealth.
A 100% Australian made RPG product.

159306.name: H is for Human
159306.description:
From publisher blurb:

They’re alive! Alive! Humanity lives! Or do they? This Spare Part supplement, H is for Human, debates the meaning of the word “extinction” and the continued survival and existence of humanity. Do remnants of the human race live, or are their twisted descendants and offspring all that remain in the Sublime? Spare Parts #4 H is for Human boasts:

Humans as Bad Guys ready for your Frankenstein Atomic Frontier game.
Is a 100% Australian made RPG Product.

159307.name: Surgeons Box
159307.description:
From publisher blurb:

Doctor, medic, craftsman; the Grafter is an important individual in Frankenstein Atomic Frontier. Both craftsman and artist, entire towns are stitched together and its citizens built from naught but the hands of a Grafter. Spare Parts #5 - Surgeons Box boasts:

Specialist Gear just for Grafters.
Is a 100% Australian made RPG Product.

159308.name: The Soup
159308.description:
From publisher blurb:

Good, bad or ugly?

The Soup holds the key to resurrecting the Earth itself and whoever has the Soup gets it all: Wealth, fame, power… But beware! From two rival Marauder Gangs to giant atomic ants the road to glory is paved with dangers. How far will you go to possess the Soup? For Frankenstein Atomic Frontier this book offers:

A full length adventure.
A wholly detailed region of the Sublime for use in any game of Frankenstein Atomic Frontier.
New Folks and Bad Guys.
A 100% Australian made rpg product.

159309.name: Wagon Train To Mars
159309.description:
From publisher blurb:

Tequila...

Fuelled...

Rocket.

And it’s heading to mars

A religious pilgrimage across the Sublime needs protection. It’s time for the characters to step in for a good old fashioned wagon train adventure through the post-atomic wastes of Earth. But with Frankenstein monsters seeking refuge on the far-flung sands of the red planet, strange experiments, living trees, glow people, angry townsfolk and a whole lot of tequila its going to be a weird ride for sure.

Wagon Train to Mars boasts:

A full length adventure for Frankenstein Atomic Frontier.
The Settlement of Horton, detailed for use in your own adventures.
New Folks and Bad Guys
A 100% Australian made RPG product.

159310.name: Invasion of the Black Slime and Other Tales of Horror
159310.description:
From the back cover:

You are crossing America on your bicycle. . .

When you stop to explore and old mining town. Soon you discover that Silverlode has been invaded by a terrible, bubbling black slime that makes animals howl and people hiss and attack each other in the night. You have no choice but to stay and help solve the mystery!

But whether you find yourself trapped in a river of oozing black evil in your own hotel room, running for your life from a hideous manlike monster, walking a narrow path over a pit of rattlesnakes, imprisoned as a sacrifice for a mad doctor's experiments, battling billions of attacking insects, or defying the eerie powers of the yellow-eyed people- never fear! If you make the right choice, you might also win a million dollars!

So get ready to plunge into adventure. And if you get caught in the black slime, just go back to the beginning and start again.

THIS ADVENTURE BELONGS TO YOU!

Welcome to the world of Which Way books- Where YOU make things happen.

159311.name: Tilt: The Star of Card Games
159311.description:
Tilt is a self-published card game system which utilizes a 66-card deck. The cards are divied into eight suits (A, B, F, L, O, R, S, U) with eight cards per suit (HIGH, DOUBLE, 4, 3, 2, 1, TWIN, LOW). Two other cards are included, the ROYAL E and a WILD card, each of which have a rank of 0 when necessary.

The 34 page rulebook describes seven games:
Regular Tilt
Reverse Tilt
Double Tilt
Royal Tilt
Chain Letter
Vocab
Tilt Crossword Solitaire

The Tilt family of games are trick-taking games where certain ranks are worth 1 or 2 points. One suit per player, plus one extra for a dummy hand, are used. Players bid for the right to name a trump suit, and the winner draws two cards from the dummy to improve his hand (and discarding two unwanted cards). The different versions change the rules or scoring in various ways.

Chain Letter is a stops-style game where players try to discard their hand by matching the last-played card. Only suits count, not ranks.

Vocab is a spelling game where players use the cards as letters, trying to make three-letter words. The TWIN cards count as two letters, so TWIN L is LL, TWIN A is AA, etc.

Tilt Crossword Solitaire is as it sounds, a solitaire game where the player fills an 8 by 8 grid with cards. Points are earned for letters in words or abbreviations, while they are lost for empty spaces in the grid.

The game and rulebook are copyright 1946 by William H. Mulder. The place of publication is Grand Rapids, Michigan. No manufacturer is listed.

159312.name: GazBC1: Shimmering Lands: Last Beacon of Blackmoor - Player's Guide
159312.description:
From the Introduction:

The Moadreg are a proud people, you must never forget that. My grandfather’s father told the tale of the Reckoning, when the elves betrayed Blackmoor and tried to destroy the earth. My grandfather's father survived that day... we survived. Gathering up what knowledge we could, we rebuilt our world. The Wasting came, and yet we endured. It forced us from our primal lands and still we thrive. Now, here, on this new continent we will regain our former glory.

159313.description:
Bolster your armies with Colossal Warfare, the third expansion for Warmachine: High Command!

Colossal Warfare contains 5 copies each of 16 different cards, plus 4 additional warcaster cards, to bring new strategies to your Cygnar, Khador, Protectorate of Menoth, and Cryx decks.

Requires Warmachine: High Command core set to play.
159313.name: Warmachine: High Command – Colossal Warfare

159314.name: Ante Portas
159314.description:
User description

This pdf set collects everything necessary to play Ante Portas. It includes 11 pdfs:
- SL Handbuch (Game master's guide)
- Spielerhandbuch (Player's guide)
- Zauberbuch (magic rules)
- Weibliche Charaktere (ready-made PCs, female)
- Männliche Charaktere (ready-made PCs, male)
- Das Gefolge des Bacchus (scenario)
- Der Überfall (scenario)
- Werkstatt des Krieges (scenario)
- Kampfplan (hex grid and combat rules)
- Zusatzmaterial I & II (additional material for the scenarios)

user comment
this publication is a .zip file

159315.name: Grim Reaper Sect
159315.description:
■Idea of the Game

Players play Hunter cards (Grim Reaper, Angel, and Devil cards) to fight over Soul cards.
Players fight over Soul cards on the table by playing Hunter cards from their hand. The player who has collected Soul cards of all 3 types, 3 Soul cards of the same type, or 5 Soul cards of any type wins the game.


■How to play

Play a Hunter card from your hand face down on the Angel or Devil team side.
After all players pass their turns or the maximum number of Hunter cards playable (as shown on the Soul card) are played, flip all played Hunter cards face up.
Add the strength of the cards on each team side (Angel and Devil) to calculate the total strength of each team.
The player who played the Hunter card with the lowest number in the team with higher strength shall receive the Soul card of that round.


■Point

In this game, you need to play a high-number card(s) to form a majority and a low-number card(s) to outdo other players in the majority.
The point of this game lies on how you handle this dilemma.

159316.name: Rogues
159316.description:
From publisher blurb:

This edition of “Fantastic Feats” – a series of feats based around a certain theme or subject – is about rogues; the thieves, scoundrels and opportunists.

Feats in this publication:

Deeper Cut - Bleeding caused by Bleeding Attacks are more difficult to stop
Leaf on the Wind - Reroll a dodge or reflex roll




Roguish Luck - Have a 2nd chance on certain events

Sneak Damage Improvement - The minimum damage from a sneak attack increases
Stronger Magic - The few spells you can cast are harder to resist
Stronger Resilience - Gain more HP from Resiliancy
Trap Finder - Traps are easier for you to find and disarm

159317.name: Arcanum College
159317.description:
From publisher blurb:

Off the coast of the Newmack Sea and to the east of Gortelburg sits the walled town of Cordicstown. Within the fortified tows in the infamous Arcanum College where young mages of wealth or talent come to learn the craft from the masters. For young adventuring mages this place offers the opportunity to improve upon their spell books and even apprentice with the masters of the mystic arts!

This offering has a twofold opportunity for adventurers. First for those who study magic they can find safe harbor at Arcanum College. For their colleagues the opportunity to rest, relax, and purchase arcane items can be had in Cordicstown. While set in the Filbar Campaign, this area can be easily combined with new or existing worlds of any level.

159318.name: Cappadocia
159318.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to Cappadocia! This ruined ancient city is home to a group of shipwrecked Gnome adventurers. For the past several years they have tried to make the best of their situation and are starting to feel at home. This is also a side adventure to FP13: Odie's Staff. Oh yea and two more words.....Gnome Airship!

This adventure is part of the Filbar series and it is suitable for a group of adventurers of any level. While part of the Filbar realm it is easily adaptable to any campaign and most systems.

159319.name: City of Filbar
159319.description:
From publisher blurb:

The jewel of the Duchy, the great city of Filbar can be utilized as a home base for adventurers or as a goal to go see. This city has over 130 points of interest and is the home to the Duke of Filbar. Rumor has it that if you can't find it in Filbar, it can't be found anywhere...short of artifacts that is! The walled city has decorative fountains and artisans of every kind. Mages can visit the towers of magic and multiple potion shops. The grand courtyard south of the castle is the home of festivals and carnivals every month. All in all, this city is large enough to provide residence or adventure to almost every adventurer. At 49 pages long there is plenty to explore!

159320.name: Corsair Bay
159320.description:
From publisher blurb:

Clover Island is home to one of the wildest towns in the world of Filbar. While the town of Corsair Bay is recognized as the home of the Pirate Kingdom it is a fully functional town. This location sits at the midway point for those crossing the Newmack Sea and is a resupply stop for most commercial traffic pirate and otherwise. The ruler of Corsair Bay is the legendary, and somewhat retired, pirate named Hannibal the Black. This fearsome pirate now enjoys ruling the community and most of the explored areas on the island but his ship still waits in port for him should he decide to set sail again.

159321.name: East Crystal Shores
159321.description:
From publisher blurb:

The small town of East Crystal Shores sits opposite the lake where Zombie Curse occurred. If the party participated in that adventure and the Crypt of Kendal Furfoot they will be quite familiar with the area. In the Filbar campaign this area was used as a go between for different adventures. This offering allows a safe haven for the party while still being close enough to excitement. Several small encounters are available just outside of town.

This adventure setting was designed for 1st/2nd Edition AD&D for the Filbar Campaign for an initial to low level group of adventurers. This adventure is easily adaptable to most any game and system. Save yourself some time and utilize it for a one shot adventure or a continuing campaign!

159322.name: Feastelburg
159322.description:
From publisher blurb:

A moderate sized town perfect for adventurers to relax in and pick up extra supplies and lift a pint or two. This particuliar town is a focal point in several adventures in Filbar including FN06: Sunken Temple of Bulu and F03: Adventure in Skull Pass. A larger settlement than Xer, Feastelburg offers a variety of different shops for the well-heeled and 'healed' adventurer. As the Mayor of Feastelburg says "Oy, pull out a stool and drop a coin or two for something that suits your fancy"

159323.name: Free City of Landos
159323.description:
From publisher blurb:

A medium sized city is perfect for adventurers who are adventuring in or near a large plains environment where natives/barbarians can be found. Landos is set in a vast plains where natives simliar to American Indians would be from. The city itself is seeking to "civilize" itself by giving more space to upscale businesses as the native population moves back out to the plains. Landos is run by the Caravan Masters who are responsible for trade throughout the civilized lands. See also F06: Euriduis of Santos. Landos is also the setting for the murder mystery FP04: Butchery of the Geldamore.

159324.name: Havendale
159324.description:
From publisher blurb:

A medium sized city is situated between Challenge of the Minotaur and Hall of the Dwarf Lords and is centered on the edge of frontier near the Border Hills. The town is walled and populated my mostly Mountain Dwarves although most races are present and welcome. This area provides an excellent respite for those fresh off the trail of adventure!

159325.name: Lord Morningstar's Keep
159325.description:
From publisher blurb:

Sometimes when wandering in the wilderness you just need to find a refuge. Welcome to Lord Morningstar’s Keep, a place of safety and security while in between adventures. The newly promoted Marquis Morningstar is a personable man who spent years on the trail fighting evil. His wilderness outpost suits his personality and his men love him for it. While not officially a “town”, this outpost can be utilized as a safe haven and a location where level training can be achieved.

159326.name: Silvantri
159326.description:
From publisher blurb:

Tucked away in the Springwood Forest is the Elven settlement of Silvantri. The town is filled with those Elves who left their ancestral home in the Treetop Forest. The community is elevated and suspension bridges link the buildings together. This setting will allow those enjoy Elven backgrounds to further their joy.

This adventure setting was designed for 1st/2nd Edition AD&D for the Filbar Campaign for any level adventurer and DM.

159327.name: Village of Xer
159327.description:
From publisher blurb:

East of the great city of Filbar is the Village of Xer. This large village is the gateway to the Eastern lands and the humanoid tribes. Xer was originally the army base for the Bloodrayne Conflict of 715. After the battle the wounded returned to the serene woods and some remained after that. Since then it has been a comfortable caravan stop for many weary travelers.

This town setting can be utilized by any level adventuring group.

This adventure setting was designed for 1st/2nd Edition AD&D for the Filbar Campaign, however it is easily adaptable to most any game and system. Save yourself some time and utilize it for a one shot adventure or a continuing campaign!

159329.description:
From the game box description: "Prattle is defined as the uttering of child's talk or to talk much and idly. In this family game, the objective is to be the first to prattle off a sentence, the words of which begin with the letters shown by the dice."

Whoever finishes their sentence first gets a point for each word in their sentence. Whoever gets to 50 points first is the winner, and judged to be the biggest "Prattler".

Components:
- 10 letter-dice:
- C/D/H/N/R/T;
- B/E/J/O/S/U;
- C/E/I/O/R/T;
- C/E/G/M/P/S;
- C/E/G/M/R/S;
- B/E/K/P/S/V;
- A/F/L/P/W/Y;
- C/E/I/N/R/T;
- A/F/L/P/S/W;
- A/F/P/Q/S/S;
- 1 number dice (5/6/7/8/9/10);
- 1 dice shaker;
- 1 roll-mat (part of box) to roll dice on;
- Pad of paper sheets to write prattles on, and keep score

boardgameversion.240331: J. W. Spear & Sons PLC. UK edition 1973

159329.name: Prattle

159330.name: Krynea Imperial Wars
159330.description:
Summary written by author/programmer for VGG
Imperial Wars is a online browser game of social and military strategy, set in Krynea, a very special world of epic fantasy and magic. In it you will take the role of a great hero who commands his people and his armies to victory, helped by friends and alliance’s companions.

It has a HUGE and defined map with bridges, mountains, rivers and ports, that greatly impacts the strategy of the heroes.

Players may choose their own style of play, focusing on military might, magic, diplomacy and adventuring, to name just a few possibilities.

Members of the same alliance can coordinate their attacks against a single target, and battles have a duration based on the number of attacking and defending troops. That allows for the arrival of reinforcements on both sides, which makes the battles highly tactical and intense.

The game uses a FREE TO PLAY approach, where players can enjoy the game for free and optionally buy a Premium account and other upgrades.

159331.name: Gardener of Thoughts: Genesis
159331.description:
Genesis

The dawn of intergalactic travel is so close that its electric body galvanizes the minds of thousands of scientists and millions of wannabe colonists.

Quantum engineering, 3D printing and artificial intelligence are pervasive branches of science, intertwined with every aspect of daily life. Everybody has access to them, everybody uses them.

The graviton is tamed and has sent the solar system abuzz, teeming with ships, robots and people.

But the dark side of humanity is showing its claws. The human civilization has been polarized by the people who want to acquire and maintain their power over the masses. The earthlings and the spacelings of this world are in conflict.

One man has breached the very wheelwork of Nature and has found a way to go anywhere in an instant, jumping through space as if walking through open doors between worlds.

The leaders of the United Planets Alliance are trying to find this man and obtain control over the greatest achievement of mankind: the obliteration of any barriers of space.

It is your destiny to intervene and set mankind on its path to the future you wish for.
