159422.name: Kirdy
159422.description:
Making words from letters drawn at random is common to many word games! But add a little cunning, an element of chance, some audacity and a lot of strategy and you get Kirdy, a word game like no other word game! You can challenge your opponents, and take their points by gambling on your wits! Beware though, as the sand falls ever too quickly through the egg-timer, the pressure builds!

The game starts with two letters and becomes progressively more difficult as new letters are added. Drawing an extra letter tile after each word, the player has to find a new word, each time betting before the draw that he will be able to do so. The word has to contain the letters drawn, in the right order.

159423.name: The Lion and the Mouse
159423.description:
The Lion and the Mouse is a spin-and-move game for two or four players. Each player has a Lion, a Mouse and a Hunter piece. The object of the four player game is to be the first to move one's Lion and Mouse pieces from their color's Start space to the corresponding Lion's Den space. In the two player game, each player controls two colors and must move both of their Lion and Mouse pieces to the appropriate dens.

Each piece has unique traits: the Hunter can "trap" (lock down) a Mouse or send a Lion back to its Start space; the Mouse can free a Lion from a trap; the Lion can send a Hunter back to its start space from outside a trap space. The spinner determines which piece may move, though some spinner spaces permit the player to choose.

159424.name: Hex
159424.description:
From publisher blurb:

HEX!

Welcome to Hero Month here at Sketchpad Studio! Once a costumed criminal, Hex is now an agent for good as a member of the Homeguard Reserves! Using her Gen+ abilities to control misfortune and mastery of magic, she's ready to take on any villain that comes her way.

159425.name: Forgotten Plaza
159425.description:
From publisher blurb:

This Product is a 32 x 30 inch, full color battlemap of a Forgotten Plaza.

The Product comes with the Square, Hex and No Overlay versions and the Virtual Tabletop Maps.

“Buying or selling? What do you mean I have no wares? Do you not see the elegant goods arrayed in front of you?”

The Forgotten Plaza is a single map of a ruined plaza. The Forgotten Plaza includes a 360-degree panoramic view from the center of the plaza just slightly to the west of the center fountain.

The Forgotten Plaza is intended for use in fantasy games. The ruined plaza also makes a suitable location for a Horror game.

Adventure hook for use with this product.

The Forgotten: When this plaza was sacked, a merchant’s shop was razed to the ground and several street performers, heralds, and shoppers were killed. Rumors in a nearby village are that if you visit the place at night, you can still see the ghosts of those slain.

If the place is visited at night, the player characters see the ghosts of a crowd that looks to be milling around shopping. They can hear faint music and faint yelling from the ghosts standing on the northwest platform. A ghostly merchant hawks his wares and has the loudest voice and seems to be able to both see and hear the player characters. The merchant attempts to buy, sell, and haggle with them but seems to have no goods at all. However, if they give him money, the item bargained for does indeed appear and is an exact replica of one of the items the merchant lost in the fire. The merchant is the key to the haunting. If he can finally sell all the items he lost in the fire, it will free him and all the lost souls tethered to this place. If the player characters offer money to the street performers or the herald, the faint music or the words of the herald gain clarity and volume, allowing the player characters to hear the music and voices clearly. The herald is announcing the new merchant shop and the street performers sing and play a song about buying and selling goods.

If the player characters try to take anything from the plaza, even broken barrels, the ghosts materialize and attack them. As long as their souls are tethered to the forgotten plaza, they cannot allow any item to leave without the proper payment. If they take an item, but leave money for it, no attack occurs.

159426.name: Sectors Twenty-Two & Twenty-Three
159426.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to "Unexplored Space." The EEG Sectors 22 & 23 introduces you to the sectors beyond "Colonized Space" and "Near Space." This tome introduces you to the systems that the six species are only just starting to colonize, the systems that they could colonize in the future, and also tells you about some long dead civilizations. In addition, it brings you some surprises once you reach the outer systems of Sectors 22 & 23...

159427.name: Found Footage
159427.description:
From publisher blurb:

Found Footage is an adventure seed for Contagion Second Edition.

The world of Contagion is a dark and terrifying place. On the surface, it looks much like the world you and I live in. Just beneath that surface, in the shadows, rages an ancient conflict between supernatural factions who all seek dominion over the Earth and control over the souls of humanity. As a byproduct of this conflict, various factions have created inhuman monstrosities and released them into the world. While most average people are fortunate enough to never encounter such terrible creatures, those who do find themselves facing things that reason cannot explain. Often, this ends tragically for the poor souls who have stumbled upon the foot soldiers of the war.

Found Footage centers on the aftermath of such an encounter. Two normal people set out on what should have been a normal weekend getaway that ends in tragedy. The only clues to the mystery of what happened to Monica Garrett and Jim McLeod are in videos and photos taken from Monica’s cellphone. It is up to the characters to solve the mystery of their disappearance.

Found Footage includes:

A 22 page adventure seed detailing the mysterious disappearance of Monica Garrett and Jim McLeod
6 new Non-Player Character sheets, ready-made to be used in game
6 seperate video assets to be used as in-game props/story aids by the Gamemaster
20 photos (JPEG Format) that can be used as player handouts/clues

159428.name: Monsters of Rock
159428.description:
From publisher blurb:

This short and f#$@in’ sweet bestiary is about every f$%#@r the Command hates: rock and rollers, Free Spacers, Cosmic Satanists, Pacificians, disciples of Elvis Presley, and the gay dudes living and cruising out in Starburn Sector.

Stay alive as long as you can, guys, because every day you slide out of your bunk and pull on your boots, you’re pissing off the bastards that run the galaxy.

“The most dangerous place in the galaxy for a young human is a rock and roll concert. The Good Datafile teaches that rock and roll is the hymn of hell and we all know that the only sinners Jesus II hates more than furries are musicians. Be not tempted by Satan’s lyrics, nor by the flesh and chrome and display in these concert stages young humans! Satan’s music is a trap. Listen to rock and roll too long, and its infernal lyrics will be the last things you hear, as a Cosmic Satanist carves out your internal organs in sacrifice to Satan Maximus!”

- Mega-Sister Lynnette Morgasa Van Tauten, preaching at a rock & roll data-crystal burning in the Manchuria District of Earth

“Sorry to interrupt the music, rockers, but we just got word the Command Navy’s moving into assault position above Rest and Be Thankful. Anybody with an armed and space-worthy ship, we can use you to push ‘em back. Even if you’re unarmed, we can use your help evac’n the natives. We’ll protect you as best we can. If you want to help, get in touch with the station and we’ll start assembling our counterfleet. Now, back to the rock….”

- Prudence Pussycat Korso, Outlaw Sex Station 09 DJ

User note: a bestiary for the Heavy Future setting.

159429.name: Tricky Chess
159429.description:
Tricky Chess is a partnership trick-taking chess game for The King's Caste deck / game system. Through successive rounds comprising recruitment, deployment, and mobilization, each team tries to eliminate the other's two kings.

Recruitment is done through trick-taking. The card that wins the trick goes to the respective player's deployment zone, regardless of who won the trick!

After the hand is played out, players Deploy their units to the board.

Next, the teams play chess against one another with the units available, until four units are eliminated, at which point a new round starts, after a little preparation for the new round.

159430.description:
Objective: Be the first reaching space 50 precisely
- moving by turns -
each player starts with 3 meeples on three different routes (tea, coffee, cacao) trying to reach space 25 (production unit) precisely.

Ending on a marked space follow instructions.
Successfully finished you have to move your big meeple up to space 50 (consumer).

Note:
Likely published 1960's; large folded map was sent out in a mailer.
159430.name: Eduscho

159432.description:
This expansion consists of an additional punchboard, that provides the player with more (and different) units choices.

Additional Scottish army counters.

Basic game is needed to play with this expansion.
159432.name: Heroes of Normandie: Lord Lovat's Commandos

boardgameimplementation.39808: Second World War at Sea: Imperial and Royal Navy

159433.description:
From the Avalanche Press website:

After just over two years of terrible warfare, the Great War came to an end with the Christmas Armistice of 1916, thanks to the mediation of American President Woodrow Wilson. But after some twenty years of peace, in 1940 the storm clouds gather once more.

The Habsburg Fleet is the second book in our alternative history series, The Second Great War. In the first book, The Kaiser’s Navy, we looked at the High Seas Fleet of 1940 and its campaigns in the North Sea and Atlantic. In this new book, the Imperial and Royal Austro-Hungarian Navy, alongside its Turkish allies, wages war in the Mediterranean Sea.

There are 210 die-cut and mounted playing pieces from the old, out-of-print Imperial & Royal Navy booklet, and 75 brand-new laser-cut pieces (scorchless and sootless!) for 285 total: 135 double-sized "long" ship pieces and 150 standard-sized ones representing task forces, aircraft and smaller warships. The Austro-Hungarian fleet that never was is present, along with French, British, Greek, Italian, German and Turkish ships, aircraft and airships.

There are also thirty new scenarios based on the battles that might have been waged on the Mediterranean Sea in this alternate world, plus more of the story of the Second Great War first begun in The Kaiser's Navy. This module is not playable by itself, but requires ownership of Bomb Alley and Black Sea Fleets to enjoy all of the scenarios.
159433.name: Second World War at Sea: The Habsburg Fleet

30069.name: Second World War at Sea: Black Sea Fleets

159434.description:
The object of the game is to have fun and learn more about the past and present of America's birthplace. A secondary object is to "win" the game by either controlling the entire city and forcing the other players out of the game or possess the most cash value at the end of an agreed on time period - 60 minutes, 90 minutes or whatever.

To start the game everyone begins at Independence Hall and receives $1776.00. Players take turns in order moving the allotted number of spaces (dice roll) in a clockwise direction around the board. If a player lands on a property with special instructions, they must be followed. If the player lands on an unowned property, it may be purchased. If the player lands on a property owned by another player, then rent must be collected. If the player lands on a property they already own, that player than receives rent from the bank. If a player rolls doubles, they roll again. A second roll of doubles send that player to the Roundhouse.

A player may sell any properties they own to any other player at any time during the game. The bank is forces to buy back any property a player choose at 67% of the original cost. The rent of each property is 10% of its original cost. If a players owns two properties of a kind (for example the Art Museum and the Academy of Music - cultural institutions) the rent is doubled. If a player owns three properties the rent is tripled. A player may not collect any rents while his pawn is at the Roundhouse or on the Expressway.

Whenever a player rolls a "one" that player gets to draw a Travel card. Whenever a player rolls a "six" that player gets to draw a News card. If a player rolls both a "one" and a "six" on the same roll that player can select either type of card, but not both. If double "ones" or "sixes" are rolled, that player draws nothing. When a player ends their turn on a block marked "Travel Card" or "News Card" that player draws the appropriate card. A player that ends their turn on either the Free Library or Franklin Institute gets to answer a Quiz card drawn by the player on their left. The "correct" answers to the Quiz cards are left to the discretion of the game players.
159434.name: The Philadelphia Game

159435.description:
This mini-expansion was a non-exclusive stretch goal during the Kickstarter campaign of the Tortuga base game and will be available as promo. It adds 17 alternative treasure tiles.

Playable only with the Tortuga base game.
159435.name: Tortuga: Queenie 1 – Treasure Tiles

159436.name: Trivial Pursuit: TV Edition – Card Set

159198.name: Trivial Pursuit: TV Edition – Master Game

159436.description:
Card set for use with the Trivial Pursuit: TV Edition – Master Game.


Each player has a circular playing piece with six pie-shaped holes. The goal of the game is to collect a pie in each color. The colors correspond to different question categories.

The board consists of a circular track with spaces in seven different colors. Six of the colors correspond to question categories while the last color gives a new dice roll. Six spaces along the track are "pie spaces", and from these there are "spokes" of track leading to the middle of the board.

Players roll a die and move along the track in any direction they like. When a player stops on a color they get a question of the appropriate category. If the player answers a question correctly while on a pie space, they get a pie of that color (assuming they don't already have it). A correct answer on another square allows the player to roll again.

Once the player has one pie in each color, she can move along the spokes to the middle of the board to win the game.

159437.name: iGranie z Gruzem
159437.description:
iGranie z Gruzem simulates living in Poland, as seen by a satiric cartoonist Kobieta Ślimak.

Players assume the roles of a young people, freshly graduated from college, with no perspectives for their further lives.

Each character has a goal of gathering 15 food, 15 money, and 15 resourcefulness to achieve their dream goals. Each also has some unique abilities to help them advance.

Players take turns rolling a die to move on the board. Along the way they will draw cards related to the area they are in - some examples involve: a new assignment at work, acquiring groceries (not necessarily by shopping), or having an intimate encounter.
Each turn characters need to eat, and once in while they will also have to pay rent. Failure to meet these requirement will have unpleasant consequences.

159438.name: San Guo Sha: Complete Edition
159438.description:
UNAUTHORIZED PRODUCTION



The information that BGG has on this item indicates that San Guo Sha is an unauthorized reproduction of BANG! with just a few differences, published in China and distributed in several coutries of the world.




Same game game as https://boardgamegeek.com/boardgame/140065/san-guo-sha-compl...
Needs merging.

Released by the end of 2011, not long after the 2011 Standard edition, it contains 2011 Standard edition plus all official expansions. Its releasing date was so close to the end of the year that it hit some local markets only early next year, so it was sometimes mistaken as 2012 Complete edition.

Legends of the Three Kingdoms (a.k.a. San Guo Sha) is a card game based off the Chinese classical novel, Romance of the Three Kingdoms, which shares many rules with Bang!, the differences are as follows:
1. The Monarch (Sheriff) may get an additional skill related to their kingdom allegiance; players routinely have two powers.
2. Weapons may have their own additional powers.
3. A card to let a player borrow a weapon from another.
4. A card to cancel the effect of other cards.
5. Peach (Beer) may be played by any player when someone loses their last life; there is no exemption of using Peach when there are only 2 players left.
6. The game proceeds counter-clockwise.

159439.name: Autorennen
159439.description: This is a car race, so obviously the winner is the one who is the first to reach the finish line. The movement of the racing cars is determined by a die. Several segments of the race track have special rules, like the results of the die counting double or half. The Players get two different kinds of cards they may use during the race instead of rolling the die. The red spurt cards allow the car to advance from a space with a yellow arrow to the next space with a red tableau. The green attack cards allow a car to exchange it's positon with any one opponent on the throw of an even number. But beware: If the die shows an odd number, the car remains on it's position and doesn't advance at all.

159440.name: San Guo Sha: Guan Yu Stamp Edition
159440.description:
UNAUTHORIZED PRODUCTION



The information that BGG has on this item indicates that San Guo Sha is an unauthorized reproduction of BANG! with just a few differences, published in China and distributed in several coutries of the world.




It's a limited edition (20000 copies with unique numbers) for collectors. It contains the base game plus all official expansions (Battle, Wind, Fire, Woods and Mountain).

In the 2011 Guan Yu Stamp edition, two characters were changed:

Zhou Yu (WU, from base game): the second ability now gives out the card before the damage is dealt.

Zhu Rong (SHU, from Fire exp.): the second ability allows a point duel only with the direct victim of her Strike (not with shackled players).


Legends of the Three Kingdoms (a.k.a. San Guo Sha) is a card game based off the Chinese classical novel, Romance of the Three Kingdoms, which shares many rules with Bang!, the differences are as follows:
1. The Monarch (Sheriff) may get an additional skill related to their kingdom allegiance; players routinely have two powers.
2. Weapons may have their own additional powers.
3. A card to let a player borrow a weapon from another.
4. A card to cancel the effect of other cards.
5. Peach (Beer) may be played by any player when someone loses their last life; there is no exemption of using Peach when there are only 2 players left.
6. The game proceeds counter-clockwise.

159442.description:
UNAUTHORIZED PRODUCTION



The information that BGG has on this item indicates that San Guo Sha is an unauthorized reproduction of BANG! with just a few differences, published in China and distributed in several coutries of the world.




All official expansions (Battle, Wind, Fire, Woods and Mountains) released in 2011, at the same time with 2011 Standard edition of the base game.

Yoka released this edition together with the 2011 Standard edition, updating the terminology and the new cardback so that it can be mixed with the latter.


Legends of the Three Kingdoms (a.k.a. San Guo Sha) is a card game based off the Chinese classical novel, Romance of the Three Kingdoms, which shares many rules with Bang!, the differences are as follows:
1. The Monarch (Sheriff) may get an additional skill related to their kingdom allegiance; players routinely have two powers.
2. Weapons may have their own additional powers.
3. A card to let a player borrow a weapon from another.
4. A card to cancel the effect of other cards.
5. Peach (Beer) may be played by any player when someone loses their last life; there is no exemption of using Peach when there are only 2 players left.
6. The game proceeds counter-clockwise.
159442.name: San Guo Sha: The Return of Legend

159443.name: San Guo Sha: Beginner's Edition
159443.description:
The beginner's edition (初出茅庐) released in 2008.

Targeted to simplify teaching, it contains only 64 cards in deck instead of 108 in a standard one, 4 heroes (Guan Yu, Gan Ning, tweaked Lv Bu and tweaked Zhang Liao) instead of 25.

It has no box, just a big envelope with a page of rule sheet and 4 sheets of uncut cards inside. You need to cut out the cards by yourself.


Legends of the Three Kingdoms (a.k.a. San Guo Sha) is a card game based off the Chinese classical novel, Romance of the Three Kingdoms, which shares many rules with Bang!, the differences are as follows:
1. The Monarch (Sheriff) may get an additional skill related to their kingdom allegiance; players routinely have two powers.
2. Weapons may have their own additional powers.
3. A card to let a player borrow a weapon from another.
4. A card to cancel the effect of other cards.
5. Peach (Beer) may be played by any player when someone loses their last life; there is no exemption of using Peach when there are only 2 players left.
6. The game proceeds counter-clockwise.

159444.name: Gremlins (1984)
159444.description:
User Summary

The mogwai are running wild! Gather them up and put them in the pen. But don't let them eat or they become nasty gremlins. Best to use your sword on those creatures. Water will make them multiply and the TV will keep them distracted. Last until the morning, But rest assured, They will be back the next night.

Not to be confused with Atari 2600 game released the same year.

159445.name: San Guo Sha: Trial Edition
159445.description:
UNAUTHORIZED PRODUCTION



The information that BGG has on this item indicates that San Guo Sha is an unauthorized reproduction of BANG! with just a few differences, published in China and distributed in several coutries of the world.




Like the San Guo Sha: Beginner's Edition, but
- you don't have to cut the cards yourself,
- Lu Bu and Zhang Liao are changed back to the Standard version,, and
- a pair of jokers is included so that you can again play poker games.

Card size shrinks a little to bridge size (88*55 mm) instead of 88*62 mm.


Legends of the Three Kingdoms (a.k.a. San Guo Sha) is a card game based off the Chinese classical novel, Romance of the Three Kingdoms, which shares many rules with Bang!, the differences are as follows:
1. The Monarch (Sheriff) may get an additional skill related to their kingdom allegiance; players routinely have two powers.
2. Weapons may have their own additional powers.
3. A card to let a player borrow a weapon from another.
4. A card to cancel the effect of other cards.
5. Peach (Beer) may be played by any player when someone loses their last life; there is no exemption of using Peach when there are only 2 players left.
6. The game proceeds counter-clockwise.

159446.description:
Titans, the demi-gods of the underworld, threaten mankind, spreading mischief and chaos in the world — but the humans are prepared to defend themselves by creating their own Titans to withstand these attacks from the underworld. While this action happens all around them, the players try to carry on with normal life, too, acquiring goods, refining them to better merchandise, and delivering them to ships and dealers — not to mention strengthening their own Titans and using troops for even more power. To keep your followers active, you need to hold enough action discs.

Panthalos lasts at most eight rounds, but the game can end earlier if the powers of the underworld become too large...
159446.name: Panthalos

159447.description:
Town Center: London / Hong Kong is comprised of 4 double-sided player boards, with the all-new London expansion map on one side, and the also all-new Hong Kong expansion map on the other. There's also an A5-sized rulesheet/cover that explains the special rules of each map.

Both maps are something new and challenging (in fact, very challenging), as players will have to manage their budget (London), and their building plans (Hong Kong) very, very carefully.

Expertly designed by Alban Viard and beautifully illustrated by Todd Sanders, these highly thematic maps were developed to showcase just how deep this game can be, while taking advantage of each city's unique characteristics.
159447.name: Town Center: London / Hong Kong

159448.name: Radio-Sende-Spiel
159448.description:
This is a simple roll and move game with the objective of touring wartime Germany and being the first to reach the final (100) space.

However, the primary objective of the game was to encourage both patriotism and obedience to wartime rules, specifically the prohibition on listening to foreign broadcasters.

When landing on domestic transmitter spaces, the players must carry out certain actions: sing a ditty, send a message, make a weather report or sing a military song. But if they land on a foreign transmitter space, they must exclaim "I have committed a criminal offense", pay a pfennig into the pot and go back to start. Worst is if they land on London's transmitter, when they must shout "God punish England!" and pay 5 pfennig into the pot as well as start over. The pot is taken by the winner.

The title "Radio-Sende-Spiel" translates in Google Translate to "Radio Broadcast Game".

159450.name: Der letzte Held (Issue 35 - Mar 1997)
159450.description:
Featured articles on the cover:

"Der Wolfenhain" - an adventure by Dirk Zeumer and Andreas Mätzing
"Wenn Riesen sich erheben" - a serialized short story, part 11
"Fenia Bodiak, Perainegeweihte" - a non-player character for Havena
a list of all previously published Havena articles

159451.name: Confounded
159451.description:
Confounded is a game for two, played on a 3x9 rectangular grid of squares. Each player has nine pieces, or "spots," in their own color. The board is divided into three 3x3 sections, with each player claiming one side and the central territory in dispute. Three each of a player's "spots" are marked with either the number one, two, or three. The game begins with the three spots in the row closest to the players, the two spots in the next row inward, and the one spots in the next row.

Players take turns moving one piece at a time and try to claim the central area or prevent their opponent from doing so. All spots move only forward. One spots move one square diagonally. Two spots move two squares directly forward. Three spots move either two squares forward and one square sideways, or one square sideways and two squares forward.

Capture of pieces is by displacement and there are a number of rules governing it. To win the game, a player must occupy five squares of the central area, or block his opponent from moving, or reduce his opponent to less than five pieces.

159452.description:
An unspeakable horror is awakening. You know him, you worshiped him, he granted you powers that the rest of us can only dream. You know that when he wakes, he will devour everything in his path. You have only one choice: you have to show an understanding of the Greater Arcane over the other cultists and be his right hand on his dimensional domination plans.

The problem comes when the rest of sectarian also want survive the awakening of the Lord, and some of them have more knowledge than you. Use the Grimoire and show the Lord that your wisdom is above the rest!

Wake up, Cthulhu! is a card game for 2-4 players in which you have to become the player with the most Arcane Knowledge points in possession on the board when Scion of the Netherworld awakes.

To do this, you hold a set of Ingredients, represented by symbols, whose combination will allow you to cast spells that will be extracting of the Grimoire. Some spells allow you to acquire such knowledge (Arcane points on the board) and others will give you the option to show your wisdom through various strategies. But beware, at the end of each round a curse falls on the players (the use of dark powers has its consequences) and can put the scale one way or the other. Some of these Curses can cause the Horror to wake earlier than expected and all players will be devoured, so at times, they must join forces before to continue fighting.
159452.name: Wake up, Cthulhu!

159453.name: Coloration
159453.description:
Coloration is played on a 17x17 grid of squares. Some squares are marked with a circle in one of eight colors; these squares form diagonal lines crossing the board from corner to corner and side to side. The board's central square is marked with a red diamond. The game includes 154 square tiles: 15 red, 25 orange, 35 yellow, 35 green, 25 blue, 15 violet, and 4 "stopper" tiles, which are half black and half color. Racks are included for each player.

The tiles are placed face down in a "pool." Each player draws seven tiles to make his "hand," and will continuously draw again to maintain a hand of seven. Players begin placing their tiles on the board, attempting to make "sequences" of colors. The rules provide for a number of these, including a rainbow sequence, a hot spectrum sequence, a cold spectrum sequence, and more. These sequences incorporate the existing colors of the board and are governed by still more rules.

Different levels of points are scored for each sequence as players complete their turns. Play continues until no more sequences are possible; the player with the most points wins the game.

159455.name: Sabacc
159455.description:
Sabacc is a gambling card game based on a game referenced within the Star Wars universe.

The game is played with a unique 76-card deck, comprised of four suits of 15 cards (Coins, Flasks, Sabres, and Staves) as well as a number of unsuited face cards. Gameplay loosely resembles poker, while hand scoring resembles blackjack. Players are dealt an initial hand, then can draw more cards to their hand, while wagering over the value of hands. Wagers are paid into two pots, a Hand Pot and a Sabacc Pot. Once the hand has been called, players reveal their hand to win the Hand Pot: the winner is the player with the highest hand value that is doesn't exceed 23. A player with a hand that totals exactly 23 or -23 has Pure Sabacc and wins the Sabacc Pot. Since unwon pots roll over into the next hand's Sabacc Pot, the Sabacc Pot can grow to be quite large.

159456.description:
Farmageddon: The Frankencrops includes fifteen new crop cards, each with a different ability while in play, for farmers to fight over, spicing up the Farmageddon base game.

The Frankencrops can be combined with the Livestocked and Loaded if desired.
159456.name: Farmageddon: The Frankencrops

159457.description:
Anti-Social: The Anti-Pawn Placement Game

The Anti-Social, pro social game about playing with your friends, more then they play with you.

In a world of games where it’s easy to win, and victory is all about claiming as much space on a board as possible, In Anti-Social, the point is to do just the opposite. Occupy as little space on the board as you can. Develop negative personality disorders, or force others to play against themselves, but keep yourself off the board.

In this game you do not want to place, or have your pawns placed on the board. Each turn players may play up to two cards (Anti-Social Behavior), and must place one pawns on the board.

Once the board is filled, the game is over. Player with the least amount of pawns on the board wins.
159457.name: Anti-Social

190088.name: Mice and Mystics: Lost Chapter – Portents of Importance

boardgamehonor.26780: 2014 Golden Geek Best Board Game Expansion Nominee

159458.description:
Mice and Mystics: Downwood Tales is a box chock full of adventure and whimsy. New storybook, a pile of new miniatures, new heroes, new villains, new location tiles, new search deck items. Downwood Tales takes the adventure outdoors. Meet frogs, turtles, rabbits, the wise sages - the three blind mice, ride leaves like parachutes out of the trees and much, much, much more.

Downwood Tales gives you multiple playable characters, new villains, new minions, tiles, a ton of new mechanics, equipment, new story arcs and more! New to this big box expansion is the gecko named Jakobe and he's not your run-of-the-mill gecko, he's a smooth operator, a ranger of the forest, a lizard for hire who is leading our heroes through some of the greatest dangers they will ever face! With more fun elements than you can shake your tail at, Downwood Tales is the next exciting installment in the Mice & Mystics world!
159458.name: Mice and Mystics: Downwood Tales

159459.name: Galilean Run
159459.description: A press-your-luck board game for two or more players. Each player is the captain of a freighter on the Galilean Run between Mars and the moons of Jupiter. The object is to get the most supplies to each of the four major moons. The challenge is to balance fuel and cargo. Each ship carries six units of fuel (represented by dice). Each cargo token displaces a fuel die. To move to the next port roll the dice. Rolls of 1 or 2 are displaced as spent. If any fuel dice remain, move up the track. At each port you can deposit or collect cargo tokens but you can only deposit other players' cargo tokens at Mars.

159460.name: Little Things: The First Offering
159460.description:
From publisher blurb:

It's the little things that count.

This first offering from Black Goat Games is nearly 30 pages concerning 8 things, complete with suggestions, notes, and tables to roll on for some of that good old fashioned randomness.

In Little Things: The First Offering you will find...

The Urmakabus: a gnome-like creature powered by loneliness and pure sadism.
Cornerstone Keep: A location you can use in games that has its very own cannibal family unit.
The Krofron: Bizarre interdimensonal alien creatures that serve to make weird fantasy even weirder.
The Tentacled Brain-Sucker: Most of you know what kind of brain-eating creatures these can be, but this expands on them a bit, giving different names for them as well as other ideas and ways to use them to whatever devious ends a GM desires.
Fun-filled tables of village stuff, horrible things, a map of a location (which can be used for Cornerstone Keep, now that I think on it...), and What's in the Box, a page of 20 options for contents in whatever box players find.




By no means comprehensive, Little Things is designed to help beleaguered Gamemasters in ways that will hopefully spark their imaginations. Is that GM you? Pepper your game up with some things... Little Things!

159461.description: Clan War: Crab Army Expansion includes a 64-page army list filled with Crab personalities and units, rules for items, new spells, a new maneuver, and a lot of great background on the Crab Clan. In addition, it includes Force cards, Tactical cards, Hida Yakamo, and twelve Hida House Guard models (13 metal figures) - only available in this box set! (Box Set - 13 metal miniatures, 64-page army book)
159461.name: Clan War: Crab Army Expansion

159462.name: Ex Labrys: Beware the Minotaur
159462.description:
Navigate your pawns across an ever-changing maze, while avoiding the Minotaur.

Players can rotate, swap, and shift tiles to create a path, while blocking opponents. They also move their pawns in an effort to get across, and the Minotaur in an effort to eat opposing pawns.

159463.name: Knights of the Dinner Table Magazine (Issue 208 - 2014)
159463.description:
"Requiem for the Tramp"

Cover by Jim Wampler

159464.name: Full Metal Planete
159464.description:
User Summary
Full Metal Planete is a video game adaptation of the board game of the same name.

BGG description
In this game of science fiction strip mining, players land on a planet and try and grab as much ore as possible and take off before the game is over. Each player has tanks, boats, barges, mining equipment and a base ship at his disposal and will have to contend with the weather and the other miners. The game uses an action point allowance system and thus is dice free. Each player on his turn has a pool of points that he can divide in a variety of ways, putting all the points into one unit's movement or dividing them among several units. Each turn is timed so players have to think quickly, and once a move has been made it cannot be retracted.

159465.description:
Tibbar and friends want to surprise their friend Beary wtih his favorite berry pie.
So it's off to the Pie Maker.Will they get there in time? They better hurry if they are going to get the berries to the pie maker before Beary eats them all. Everyone wins when all 5 of Beary's friends get their berries to the Pie Maker!

Roll the die and perform the action shown on the Action Board to move Tibbar and Friends along the game board. Act fast though! Beary's hourglass is always running. Don't let him catch you!

Work together with the other players to get all five characters to the Pie Maker to win the game!

Features

Collaboration
Action- Based Strategy
Fine Motor Skills
159465.name: Save the Pie

159466.name: Cow Cents
159466.description:
MOOOVE your Money Tokens to the money pool to match the amount on the Goal card and the Money Tokens are yours! Don’t worry if you can’t make a total match, you can cash in your Cow Token and the pool is yours! Have the Money Tokens with the most dollar value at the end of the game and win!

Add Money Tokens to money pools to reach goal amounts. Match the goal exactly and collect all the tokens from that pool. Be careful not to exceed the goal amount or the Money Tokens from that money pool will go to the other players. Players calculate the monetary value of the Money Tokens they’ve collected and the player with highest total wins!

Features

Monetary Values
Adding and Subtracting Amounts
Adaptive Strategy

159467.name: Vinculum
159467.description:
Vinculum the fast paced game of fractions.
Race to get the most Fraction Tiles and win! A fraction consists of a Numerator (on the top)and a Denominator (on the bottom). The line that separates the two is called a Vinculum. Learning how to reduce and expand fractions will help players recognize equivalent fractions.

Turn a new Fraction tile face-up and all players start searching for a match. Quickly slap a tile with a matching equivalent fraction to claim it. Claim the most tiles to win the game!

Features

Recognizing Equivalent Fractions
Reducing and Expanding Fractions
Observational Reflexes

159468.name: Brawl
159468.description:
In Brawl, two players fight to the finish. You don't win until your opponent is knocked out.

Each round, both players play a card from their hand face down, then they flip over and execute the card played in the previous round. The five cards (Block, Dodge, Jab, Hook, and Roundhouse) allow the players to use offensive and defensive techniques and combinations to reduce their opponents health to 0. If your health reaches 0, you\'re knocked out and you lose.

159469.description:
Ortus Regni is a novel card game inspired by the late Anglo-Saxon period of English history. A time of warring Earls, claiming whatever lands they could... establishing fiefs, cultivating powerful vassals, fighting and engaging in endless political struggles — all while Vikings roamed not just the sea, but the land. It is truly a Dark Age. Or is it? Lasting for 600 years, until the Norman Conquest of 1066, this era decided the future of a great kingdom that would become England.

Designing your Earl Deck before play begins is one of the key features of the game. Ortus Regni is a deck-design game, rather than a deck-building game — that is, you are entirely in control of the deck that you will begin play with in a game of Ortus Regni. Several canonical Ortus Regni deck design concepts exist — such as a Lord deck, an Army (Land) deck, a Politics deck, or an Emissary (Monk) deck, and more — but such concepts are only the start of your design options. The Earl Deck you put together can be a subtle hybrid of several concepts, or something entirely different and unusual.

Your opponents in Ortus Regni will have access to the exact same suite of cards that you do when they design their own Earl Decks for game play. So it all comes down to your choices and your strategies! There is also tactical space during a game to zig and zag, even if you find yourself against an Earl Deck design that you did not anticipate. You might pull out an unexpected win nonetheless if you play your deck well.
159469.name: Ortus Regni

159470.description:
In Jungle Rumble, you're in charge of a herd of cats — yes, cats — and those cats must do your bidding in order to mine, build plantations, water your farm, and recruit more helpful kitties.

Each round, a number of action tiles are available. On a turn, a player chooses one of the actions, placing as many of her cats on it as she wants, with more cats leading to a stronger action. Each other player in turn can take the same action, but only at a strength of one cat. After each player has chosen an action, unchosen actions are sweetened for the next round, the start player marker rotates, then the next round starts.

Players need to grow their herd of cats in order to take additional actions, but you must also feed your herd or else the cats will wander off into the forest or who knows where. At the end of the game, players score for the size of their feline herd, the amount of water supplied to their field, their supplies of food and gold, and a few other things. Whoever has the most points becomes the champion of this vivid forest!
159470.name: Jungle Rumble

159471.name: Deluxe Trivial Pursuit
159471.description:
A videogame version of the classic game Trivial Pursuit.

User Summary

Deluxe Trivial Pursuit is a faithful representation of the experience of playing Trivial Pursuit. Players roll an (animated) die to move around the board. When a category is selected the scene changes to a room and an animated cartoon bird character walks on to pose the question. In addition to the straightforward trivia questions of the style found in the original board game, there are also picture questions, and musical questions where the bird character will sit at a piano and a short piece of music will be played. An animated spider on the right of the screen acts as a timer for each question.

159472.name: RPG Merchant Tycoon!!
159472.description:
In RPG Merchant Tycoon!!, players take the roles of optimistic start up entrepreneurs, looking to set up shops in the bustling villages, towns or cities spread throughout the world of your typical 8-bit RPG game. However, these said villages, towns and cities aren't big enough for the 2 (to 4) of yas'! So it's time to get busy and dirty, trading and searching for loot to fulfill the growing line of adventurers looking for some gear! Expand your shop, spend your Gold stock (or hoard it!) wisely, trade with other rival shops, keep secret Stock all to yourself, call in favors from your happy Clients.....do whatever it takes to clinch market Dominance and be the only show in town and start reeling in the BIG money! Who knows, maybe that Flaming Sword of Justice you just sold will be used by the Hero that will save the world?!

RPGMT!! is a 30-60min 2-4 Player high strategy card game in which the player's goal is to finish the game with the best balance between: The amount of Client's orders they were able to fulfill; the amount of Gold they personally have by the end; and the total quality's worth of items in their Display.

Each turn Players can take up to 2 "Actions" (unless they get extra Actions thanks to fulfilling certain Client orders) in their attempt to fulfill Client orders for certain weaponry or item...ry. These Actions let the Players manipulate their Stock items (or Hand cards) and/or their Display items (cards face up in front of a Player for everyone to see/trade) in specific ways to try and beat the rush to fulfill those orders! Ran out of Actions for your turn, but you're only ONE Action away from fulfilling that order?! No Worries!! There are "Gold Actions" that you can use in a pinch, which let you spend Gold to do certain Actions that DON'T count towards your Action limit for your turn....WOOHOO!! After all the Clients have been fulfilled, the game ends and Players then move on to calculating "Dominance", which will determine who the TRUE Merchant Tycoon is!!

The strategic decisions and stiff competition in RPGMT!! really heat up quick due to the fact that Players start out with only a limited number of Actions per turn AND a limited number of cards they can have, so EVERY decision counts! Everything from in what order you'd like to take your Actions, which Client you should fulfill, and should you or shouldn't you use Gold are crucial to Dominance. You might spend all your Action efforts to build up enough items to fulfill an order for a specific Client, but then the Player before you fulfills them leaving you at a disadvantage with items that you might not need now!! Remember, it's not just playing the current Client market, it's also knowing and playing to the weaknesses of your fellow Players!

159473.description:
Quartermaster General is a fast-paced game that puts you in command of the major powers of the Second World War. In the game, supply is crucial to keep your armies and navies fighting; destroy your enemies' supply lines and their forces will surrender!

During play, you control one or more countries on either the Axis or Allied team and try to score as many victory points (VPs) for your team as you can through the use of cards or by occupying the starred supply spaces. Each major power has a unique set of cards with which to marshal its forces, which are represented by wooden army and navy pieces. After twenty rounds of play, the team with the most VPs wins.

Note: The French edition of Quartermaster General, known as Quartermaster, includes the Quartermaster General: Air Marshal expansion that is sold separately in the English edition.
159473.name: Quartermaster General

boardgameaccessory.208116: Quartermaster General: Alternative Histories – Blank Cards

159474.name: No Good Deed
159474.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A voyage to Saturn is sent dramatically off-course by a deadly power surge and a desperate crash landing onto the surface of the moon of Rhea. But all is not as it seems, and what starts out as a rescue mission quickly escalates into something more revolutionary.

No Good Deed is a 26-page black and white PDF featuring a Rocket Age adventure designed for four to six players.

159475.name: Board At Sea
159475.description:
Board at Sea is a pirate themed strategy game for 2 players that takes about half an hour.

The board shows 2 ships, side by side, and the rope bridges that connect them. Start by standing your stones on your ship so that your opponent can't see what they are. On each turn you'll move a piece and roll dice to resolve attacks. Your crew moves between ships, the cannons fire across the board, and the treasure tries its best to stay hidden.

The pirates win by stealing one of the treasure chests and bringing it back to their ship, and the merchants win if they can stop the pirates.

159476.name: Cay Control
159476.description:
Cay Control is a pirate themed strategy game for 2 players that takes about half an hour.

The board shows a sea dotted with islands and pirate bases on either side. Start by placing your ships on your base. On each turn you'll roll the dice and move your ships. You capture enemy ships by landing on them, but you have to bring them back to your base to claim them. Stacks of ships can be captured over and over, and you can even break out with a lucky roll.

The first person to claim all of their opponents ships wins the game.

159477.name: Divide The Booty
159477.description:
Divide the Booty is a pirate themed trading game for 2-4 players that takes about an hour.

The board shows a treasure chest with a race track around the outside. Start by placing your stone on the start space and all the booty face-down on the chest. Each player draws three pieces of booty and stands them up so the other players can't see what they are. On each turn you'll trade a piece, bank a piece, and draw a piece. Try to collect the biggest set of one symbol, but watch out for the bombs. Once all the booty has been banked, count up your sets and move around the track.

Shuffle the booty and play again until someone circles the track and wins the game.

159478.name: Escape The Plank
159478.description:
Escape the Plank is a pirate themed race game for 2-6 players that takes about half an hour.

The board shows a ship with a U-shaped track with the plank on one end and a rowboat on the other. Start by placing your crew on the start space at the back of the ship. On each turn you'll roll the dice and move the crew along the track. You can move any crew you want, even if it belongs to someone else. If your crew gets pushed off the plank, it's out of the game. If your crew makes it to the rowboat, it's safe.

Once all of the crew is off the ship, whoever has the most crew in the rowboat wins the game.

159479.name: Pillage / Burn
159479.description:
Pillage / Burn is a pirate themed bluffing game for 2-8 players that takes about half an hour.

The board shows a mystery ship surrounded by a set of pillage/burn spaces for each player. Start by placing all of the loot in the center of the board. On each turn as the scout, you'll roll the die in secret and try to trick the other players. Everyone who got it right collects some loot, and everyone you tricked pays you.

Once all the loot has been collected, the pirate with the most wins the game.

159480.name: Sea Stories
159480.description:
Sea Stories is a pirate themed storytelling game for 2-4 players that takes about an hour.

The board shows a grid with difficulty ratings surrounded by quick descriptions of the story elements. Start by choosing whether each player will be a Fresh Fish or Salty Dog. On each turn you'll roll the dice and tell a story based on what you roll. The number of story elements you use determines your placement on the board. If the other players catch an interaction you forgot, they'll call hornswaggle and prevent you from placing a piece.

The first person to get a three-in-a-row wins the game.

159481.name: The Blockade
159481.description:
The Blockade is a pirate themed strategy game for 2 players that takes about half an hour.

The board shows a sea with marked starting spaces and pirate island on one side. Start by placing your ships on the marked spaces and setting the difficulty. On each turn you'll move one of your ships. Pirates are more maneuverable, but there are only 3 of them. The navy moves slower, but has a large fleet.

The pirates win if they can get just one treasure back to the island, and the navy wins if they can stop the pirates.

159482.description:
Liaoshen Campaign(遼瀋戰役), 1948 is a 2-4 players operational-level board wargame that simulates the battles between Chinese Communist Party (CCP,中國共產黨) and Kuomintang (KMT,中國國民黨) from Sep, 1948 to Nov, 1948 during the second Chinese Civil War. It is the first game in the Chinese Civil War Series(CCWS,國共內戰系列). 2 players command the People Liberation Army (PLA), and the other 2 players command the National Government Army (NRA) respectively.

Each turn represents 7 days and each hex is about 10 km across. There are several kinds of basic combat units, including infantry, artillery, artillery, cavalry, armor, etc. The scale of the basic unit is from regiment to division size. There are three phases in the sequence of play, strategic, operational, and supply phases. During the strategic phase, player use strategic move to deploy your units to the right place quickly. During the operational phase, players use cards to activate the corps HQ to command its units to move, combat, and advance after combat. You can also use cards to initiate some events or special tactics during combat. During supply phase, you produce the resource points from the city/town you occupied and refill your hand cards.

There are four scenarios in this game, including Liaoshen Campaign (7 turns), Battle of Jinzhou (4 turns), Battle of Heishan (3 turns), Huludao evacuation (2 turns). The victory condition is different from both sides in different scenarios.
159482.name: Liaoshen Campaign, 1948

159483.description:
Tholian starships are small starships of characteristic shape, utilized by the Tholian Assembly during the 23rd century. These vessels are armed with plasma torpedo-like weaponry, but their most powerful weapon is the so-called "Tholian web", which is "weaved" by two or more Tholian vessels around an enemy ship, trapping it. The web can then be contracted, destroying the vessel inside.

The Star Trek: Attack Wing – Tholia One Expansion Pack is the competitive prize for "The Tholian Web" episode during Star Trek: Attack Wing Organized Play.
159483.name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Tholia One Expansion Pack

159484.description:
Skilled Helmsman Resource (5 SP)
Players receive the 1 Full About Maneuver Template and place it on one of their Ship Cards. For the duration of the battle, the chosen ship (and only that ship) may perform the Full About [FULLABOUT] Maneuver.

This resource is a participation prize for the episode Star Trek: Attack Wing Organized Play Tournament, "The Tholian Web."
159484.name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Skilled Helmsman Resource

159485.description:
Unique Federation Elite Talent (2 SP)
When you spend a [BATTLESTATIONS] Token, you may discard this card instead of returning the [BATTLESTATIONS] Token to the Action Token supply.

This resource is a participation prize for the episode Star Trek: Attack Wing Organized Play Tournament, "The Tholian Web."
159485.name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Red Alert

159486.description:
Unique Federation Elite Talent (5 SP)
ACTION: Discard this card to place 1 [EVADE], 1 [SCAN], 1 [BATTLESTATIONS] Token and 1 Auxiliary Power Token beside your ship. Your ship cannot perform any free Ations during the same round that you perform this Action (either before or after you perform this Action).

This resource is the competitive prize for the episode Star Trek: Attack Wing Organized Play Tournament, "The Arena."
159486.name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Full Alert

159487.description:
Chief Engineer Resource (5 SP)
Players receive 5 Chief Engineer Tokens and place them beside their Ship Cards. A player may only use Chief Engineer Tokens for his/her ships.

Once per round, during the Combat Phase, a player may spend 1 Chief Engineer Token to gain one of its effects.

This resource is a participation prize for the episode Star Trek: Attack Wing Organized Play Tournament, "The Arena."
159487.name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Chief Engineer Resource

159488.description:
Designated by Starfleet as the Borg Type 03, this class of Borg starship was used by a rogue faction of Borg led by Lore. This unusual design was asymmetrical and totally unlike the previously encountered Borg cube and Borg scout, causing Captain Jean-Luc Picard to speculate whether it was something they constructed or an alien vessel they captured and assimilated. Whatever its origins, the vessel was still heavily armed and massively armored, capable of great destructive power.

This ship is part of the 6th wave of expansion packs for the Star Trek: Attack Wing game.
159488.name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Soong Expansion Pack

159489.description:
The USS Enterprise (NCC-1701-A) was a Federation Constitution-class heavy cruiser that was in service with Starfleet in the late 23rd century. This starship became the second Federation ship to bear the name Enterprise.

Externally, the Enterprise-A was virtually identical to the refit USS Enterprise, destroyed several months prior to the launch.

This ship is part of the 6th wave of expansion packs for the Star Trek: Attack Wing game.
159489.name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – U.S.S. Enterprise (Refit) Expansion Pack

159490.description:
A group of these warships formed part of the first wave of Dominion ships to pass through the Bajoran wormhole, following their annexation of the Cardassian Union in 2373.

Gul Dukat would command one of these vessels during his year-long reign as leader of Cardassia. Its first notable appearance in battle against the Federation was at the outbreak of the Dominion War in late 2373, where it served as a command ship of the combined Dominion and Cardassian fleet.

This ship is part of the 6th wave of expansion packs for the Star Trek: Attack Wing game.
159490.name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – 2nd Division Cruiser Expansion Pack

159491.description:
Objective: Be the first reaching Leipzig
- moving by turns -
each player determines (by die) his/her starting point - you must roll your die until you get a different starting number/position.
Move according die roll into indicated direction (clockwise/contraclockwise) around the board. If the space is already occupied you end on skip one turn.
After you have finished one round head for Leipzig. Ending on a marked space follow instructions glued into the lid.
159491.name: Fuhrmanns-Leut' sind lustige Leut'

159492.name: The Game of 49
159492.description:
Starting with $49 apiece, players in The Game of 49 bid to buy spaces on the 49-square (7-by-7) game board.

Randomly drawn number cards are auctioned one at a time, with the highest bidder placing a chip on the matching board space. Wild/Payoff cards give players a choice of where to place their chip and also award cash to all players for their chips on the board: $7 per chip, with a maximum payoff of $49.

The first player to claim four spaces in a row, in any direction, wins.

159493.description: The goal of the game is to reach Mehisto at the center of the game board and defeat him. The movement is determined by the spinner. The playing pieces have two sides, the costumed hero and his alter ego (for instance Spider-Man and Peter Parker). While in their secret identity the players are safe from attack and can move into position. To attack Mephisto they have to change into their superhero identities. On the Zoom Spaces the heroes get to collect Power Cards to use in the fight against Mephisto. If a Superhero succesfully attacks Mephisto, he gets a Talisman Card. The first Player who gets 3 Talisman Cards wins the game.
159493.name: Marvel Comics Super-Heroes Game

159494.name: Dead Hungry Diner
159494.description:
"Dead Hungry Diner" is a fun and fast paced action-puzzler with a fresh approach to restaurant management. Guide Gabe and Gabby, the orphan twins, and discover the secrets of Ravenwood village. Seat, serve and satisfy a variety of monsters but be quick before they get impatient and leave without paying. Call Frankie the bouncer to break up fights between feuding customers. Use a pinch of magic to perfect your customer service and build up big bucks. With a bulging bank balance visit the "Blackest Market" and purchase power ups. Revel in more than 50 levels and two game modes of a monster feeding frenzy and manage the most unusual restaurant you have ever seen.

Source: The Game Website.

159496.description:
The third and final part of the Isstvan trilogy, this book details the aftermath of the Dropsite Massacre on Istvaan V, and two other major battles fought between the Loyalist and Traitor Legions as the Horus Heresy swept out from the Isstvan system and into the wider Imperium of Mankind: the Battle of Phall and the Invasion of Paramar.

Also featured are the background and game rules for the units, characters and vehicles of the four Legions covered in this book: the Alpha Legion, Imperial Fists, Raven Guard and Iron Warriors, and a Mechanicum army list, as well as new campaigns and missions.

The book itself is a full colour 285 page hardback, leather bound with metal corner clasps, foil-edged pages and embossed and silvered text.
159496.name: The Horus Heresy Book III: Extermination

159497.description:
Objective: Be the first reaching Berlin (making a round trip - red route) - main game
- moving by turns -
Roll the die and move forward. If you end on a marked space, follow the instructions glued into the lid.

Note:
There are a few different routes (yellow and blue) with slightly different rules. It's remarkable, that at that time a GDR publisher produced a game with routes through all of Germany.
159497.name: Gute Fahrt durch unser deutsches Vaterland!

159498.description:
The second expansion to For the Crown, The World is Round introduces several new units with the ability to move in a cylindrical fashion – moving off the edge of the board and re-appearing on the other side. Rush your opponent with the vicious Raider, and command your troops with the Khan. Take charge of the battlefield and utilize maneuvers that will make your opponent's head spin with The World is Round.
Note: For the Crown expansion kit 2: The World is Round is not a "stand alone" game. You must own a copy of For the Crown 2nd edition to use it. This expansion kit cannot be used with the first edition of For the Crown.

Game Data:

Complexity: 3 on a 9 scale
Solitaire Suitability: 2 on a 9 scale

boardgameversion.240660: For the Crown Expansion #2: The World is Round

159498.name: For the Crown Expansion #2: The World is Round

159499.name: La Terre Creuse
159499.description:
User Summary:

The core rulebook for the Terre Creuse rpg. It contains the game rules, a description of the world, its (lack of) technology, the different factions that rule it and those who oppose them, rules and background for the three types of magic, and an 8 pages scenario.

37974.name: We Didn't Playtest This At All: Chaos Pack

boardgamecompilation.80012: We Didn't Playtest This At All: Blue Deck

boardgameintegration.31016: We Didn't Playtest This At All

159500.description:
From the box:

Many will enter, some will win. All will laugh.

We are back with more random! And you like random. Or you will, soon!
A full new set of cards that can be played with the original game, or on their own. Be sure to watch out for sharks! And cake. Especially the cake.

Play Summary (from We Didn't Playtest This At All)

Everyone starts with 2 cards. On your turn, draw one card from the deck, and then play one from your hand following the instructions on the card. There are many hazards to avoid, including: bombs, dragons, arrows, laser pointers, arrows, black holes, Rock Paper Scissors battles, number battles, zombies, etc. Luckily items abound that can save you, too: spaceships, science, shields, dinosaurs and a kitten ambush!

This is a standalone game that may be integrated with We Didn't Playtest This At All.
159500.name: We Didn't Playtest This Either with Blue Deck and Dice Are Fun Expansions
